loans.name: Kutakurana Group

texts.en: This is 47 year old Elizabeth from Murehwa, a village 75 km northeast from the capital city Harare. She is married with five children, three attending school. Elizabeth runs a retail business selling groceries. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are stiff competition from other traders. Elizabeth has requested for a loan of $300 to increase her stocks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her improve the family's general welfare. In the future, Elizabeth plans to operate a large supermarket.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail items like sugar, flour, cooking fat, rice etc.

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en:
Sothy, 58, is married with six children. She resides in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Chnang province. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and planting vegetables for 39 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 25,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for the future needs. 

Sothy’s group consists of three members who are all female and Sothy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Sothy completely paid back the loans and successfully used the loans to better support her family. She and her group members are applying for a loan. 

As the leader, Sothy will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income and have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en: Valeria, a farmer from Bohol, Philippines, is a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than 20 years now together with her husband. Farming is their main source of income. Valeria wants to improve their farm but lacks the financial resources to do so. She joined CEVI to gain access to the loan services offered by the organization to small entrepreneurs like her. She is asking for a loan to buy new pesticide spray, fertilizer and seedlings. In the future, Valeria wants to make their farming business a success so that it will generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy new pesticide spray, fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is a 61 year old married man from Ubay, Bohol. He has 10 children.The youngest child is 13 while the oldest is 26 and not yet married. Others are already married. 

Rodrigo is into fishing. He catches and sells fish at the market. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fishing net, nylon, and floaters to increase his catch and to be be able to increase sales. In the future,  Rodrigo would like to expand his business to support his family and to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, nylon and floaters

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina is engaged in vegetable farming. She is married and has three grown children. She is asking for a loan to buy a new pesticide sprayer, fertilizer and seedlings. She believes that through this loan, she can improve her farm and its harvest. Furthermore, she can generate more income necessary for her family’s needs and consumption.

loans.use: to buy a new pesticide sprayer, fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Sinat, 34, is married with two children and resides in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, in Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. For the last fourteen years, she has been farming rice as the primary source of her family’s income. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 15,000 KHR per day and enables her to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sinat’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and they both have been with VisionFund for one cycle. The previous loan from VisionFund helped Sinat better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sinat will use her portion to spend on labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees for plowing the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyem's Group

texts.en:
Sreyem is 22 years old and married with one daughter who is still young. She lives in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She earns a living through farming rice and planting cassava. Her family earn about KHR 22,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

This is Sreyem’s group loan with Kiva partner VisionFund; Sreyem has been a member of VisionFund for one cycle. She successfully used her previous loan to better her living condition. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sreyem will use her portion to pay for labor fees for plowing the field. She hopes to make more rice and cassava so as to sell it for a good price and make a better living.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees for plowing the field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
This is Araceli, 53, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Frank, a driver, and is a mother to her children. Araceli operates a computer rental shop. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, very few people own their own computers. Thus, there is a need for them, especially for students who need to do their research and papers. She rents computers by the hour and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new computer units, spare parts, and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Araceli hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and were she also draws strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela tiene 52 años y tiene  un hijo que tiene la  edad de 15 años, que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería, ella tiene un puesto fijo  que se encuentra en la zona de Pampahasi,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Graciela va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de empanadas y galletas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital, la Sra. Graciela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, su deseo es poder tener una cafetería donde pueda ofrecer también sus deliciosas masitas a toda su clientela.
texts.en: Graciela, 52 years old, has a 15-year-old son who is in school. She works by making and selling a variety of pastries at a bakery. Graciela has a permanent job in the Pampahasi area. This loan is her first cycle with this institution, which she will use to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, and yeast to make empanadas and biscuits. She is requesting this loan due to a lack of capital. Graciela faces challenges in her business, which will improve her quality of life. She will use the profits to increase her production. She wants to be able to have a cafe where she can serve her delicious pastries to her customers.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and other items for her business

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Cesar sigue con la misma actividad de la carpintería, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de madera por mayor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramienta para su trabajo como también madera para la fabricación de puertas ya que tiene pedidos en esta época ya que tiene mucha demanda de este producto.
texts.en:
Cesar continues with the same business activity, carpentry.  He says that the previous loan went well for him because he used it to buy wood in bulk.

This time he is requesting the loan to buy tools for his work.  He will also buy wood to make doors because he has orders at this time of the year.  He has a lot of demand for this product.

loans.use: to buy tools and wood.

loans.name: Loyda Eulises

texts.es:
La señora Eulises tiene su profesión es banca y finanza  se graduó en este ramo de la finanza pero por es cases de empleo no ha podido trabaja en su profesión.

Es casada su esposo trabaja como conductor de equipo pesado.

Con mucho esfuerzo y empeño han venido ahorrando y sintieron la necesidad de establecer este negocio en su casa de habitación, y solicitaron un financiamiento  para invertirlo en su negocio.

Ahorra necesita otro crédito para invertirlo comprar más medicina, en la  que ha tenido demanda.
texts.en:
Eulises is trained in banking and finance and graduated in the field of finance, but due to a lack of work, she has not been able to work at her profession.  She is married and her husband works as a heavy machinery operator.

With a lot of effort and hard work, she had been saving and felt the need to start this business in her home, and requested a loan to invest in her business.  Now, she is requesting another loan to purchase more medicine that is in demand.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceutical products: syrup, pills for pain, infection, and pressure, ointments, and injections.

loans.name: Eknar

texts.es: Eknar de 24 años de edad es soltero y vive con sus padres .Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros inter distritales en su localidad pero tambien a las labores agrícolas consistentes en la producción de cacao y café orgánico.Día a día recorre diversas arterias de su zona transportando pasajeros con quienes muchas veces entabla amistades y hacen de su trabajo muy reconfortante.En ocasiones la lluvia es su principal inconveniente pues las vías por donde circula no son asfaltadas haciendo de su labor algo complicada.Con el paso de los años espera seguir trabajando con la motivación que lo caracteriza para cumplir sus objetivos los cuales parten desde adquirir su propio vehículo así como un terreno agrícola para dedicarlo al alquiler y obtener mejores ingresos.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que le permite crecer económicamente.Con los 1,500 nuevos soles contratará trabajadores del lugar para la cosecha de cacao orgánico esperando recuperar el capital invertido desde hace 8 meses.
texts.en:
Eknar is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents. He makes a living from transporting passengers between districts in his area, but also from consistent agricultural work in the production of organic cacao and coffee. On a day to day basis he travels a number of the main routes in his area, transporting passengers he often becomes friendly with and who make his work very heartwarming.

At times, the rain is his primary inconvenience as the roads he circles are not paved, making his work a bit complicated. As the years pass, he hopes to keep working with his characteristic motivation to achieve his goals, starting with acquiring his own vehicle as well as agricultural land he can rent out and earn more income.

This is his first loan with Kiva and he feels very grateful for the opportunity provided as it allows him to grow financially. With the 1,500 Peruvian nuevos soles he will hire workers from the area to harvest organic cacao, hoping to recuperate the capital invested 8 months ago.

loans.use: to hire workers from the area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rafters, zinc, iron, cement, sand, and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Giovanny Cesar

texts.es:
Giovanny es un joven de 23 años que vive con su familia.
Giovanny estudia traducción e interpretación en una universidad local. El ha elegido esta carrera porque considera que es muy importante debido a la globalización del mercado ya que muchas empresas requieren profesionales de ese rubro. Giovanny  ha empezado a estudiar hace 6 años y solo le falta un ciclo que consta de 04 meses para terminar sus estudios, está muy feliz por los logros que está alcanzando y próximamente desea empezar una nueva carrera.  El préstamo le servirá para pagar los gastos de su bachillerato para culminar su carrera con exito, su mayor sueño en la vida es tener su propia empresa.
Giovanny está muy emocionado por saber que personas de todo el mundo le van a apoyar en sus estudios, principalmente sin conocerlo.
texts.en:
Giovanny is a 23-year-old young man who lives with his family.

Giovanny studies translation and interpretation at a local university. He has chosen this career because he thinks it is very important due to the globalization of the market, as many businesses require professionals of this nature. Giovanny began his studies 6 years ago and only has one semester to go, just 4 months left to finish his studies. He is very happy with his achievements and wants to start a new career soon. The loan will serve to pay his university expenses so he can finish his degree successfully. His greatest dream in life is to have his own business.

Giovanny is very excited to know that people all over the world are going to support him in his studies, especially because they don't know him.

loans.use: to pay his university expenses

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Tol, 34, is married with one son, who is in school. She lives in a wooden house with her family in a rural village of the Sa Ang district. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 11 years, she manages to earn about $5 (US) per day and can save about $1.50 each day for her future needs. 

Tol has been with VisionFund for six cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans, which she used successfully to better support her living expenses and pay for her son’s education. 

She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland and she will use a portion for labour fees. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Bertha María

texts.es:
Doña Bertha María vive en un populoso barrio de la capital de Managua departamento de Nicaragua, es una persona con trabajo estable, desempeñándose como operador central telefónica desde hace veinte y ocho años, su estado civil es madre soltera con tres hijos a su cargo con edad escolar.

Se presento a CEPRODEL  para solicitar  crédito para compra de materiales de construcción  tales como bloque, hierro, cinc, para anexo de un cuarto y darle a sus hijos mejor condición. 

Con este financiamiento ampliara su casa ya que es pequeña.
texts.en:
Bertha María lives in a populated neighborhood in the capital of Managua, a department of Nicaragua. She is a person with a stable job, working as a call center operator for the last twenty-eight years. She is a single mother with three school-aged children in her care.

She went to CEPRODEL to ask for a loan to buy construction materials like blocks, iron and zinc to add a room on and give her children better living conditions. With this loan, she will expand her house, as it is small.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Aiah David's Group

texts.en:
Meet teachers of a vocational institute in the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of hard-working and dedicated teachers has come to Salone Microfinance Trust, a Kiva partner based in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 8,000,000 Sierra Leonean leone for the entire team. 

With the help of this loan, these men will be able to solve their immediate and most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can easily repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their institution’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

On the left in the photo is Sahr, the team’s featured leader. Born in Gandorhun, in eastern Sierra Leone, the 45-year-old is married to a teacher, and the couple has three children. Sahr has been a school teacher for 18 years. He has requested this loan to buy building materials for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for 3 x 1 1/2 purlins, 28 x 12 sheets of zinc, cement, blocks, and labor

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María,  es una persona  trabajadora, teniendo como actividad venta de comida su especialidad sopa, ubicada en su casa de habitación en la capital. A tiende su negocio junto a su esposo.

 Solicita el  préstamo a ceprodel para invertir en mejora de su negocio, reparación y pintura del local y  Esto con el propósito de arreglar su negocio.  El crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más insumos para su negocio.

Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por medio de los préstamos ha incrementado su negocio y le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y tener  una  condición mejor de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana María is a hardworking woman who makes a living selling food she prepares in her home, located in the capital city. Her specialty is soup. She works alongside her husband to maintain this business.

Ana María is requesting this loan from Ceprodel so that she may invest it to improve her business. She plans to do some repairs and painting to the building. 

Ana María used her previous loan to buy ingredients for her business. She is very grateful for the Kiva and Ceprodel for the opportunity this loan presents her and for the trust they have put in her. With the help of these loans, she has been able to improve her home and the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to improve her business by painting and doing some repairs.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem, 42, lives in Ijevan City with his wife and two school-aged children. He has been engaged in trading activities since graduating from secondary school. Since 1997, he has run a fruit and vegetable trading business, which brings him sufficient profit to provide for his family's needs.
 
Artem’s wife helps him in this activity. Artem is very pleased and says that this business has enabled him to buy furniture and a car.

Now he seeks a loan to buy an assortment of fruit and vegetables for resale in his rented stall in Ijevan market. He will use the anticipated profits to repair his house.

loans.use: To buy an assortment of fruit and vegetables for resale in his rented stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth tiene 35 años es casada tiene dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 14 años, que se encuentran estudiando,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida ella vende pollo frito tiene su pensión  que se encuentra en la localidad de El Torno,  La señora Elizabeth es una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La señora Elizabeth les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un horno eléctrico para la elaboración de sus comidas, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Elizabeth is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are 5 and 14 years old and who are in school.  She sells fried chicken for a living from her at-home restaurant in El Torno.  Elizabeth is a very hardworking person who through determination is little by little gaining stability and solvency and even popularity because she is very well-known to her customers for giving very good customer service.  With the money from the loan she will buy an electric oven to make her food.  She tells us that with a lot of work she can grow more and keep accruing wealth for her family's and her own well-being.  She is happy with the institution and it thankful for the help it has given her.

loans.use: to buy an electric oven

loans.name: Binti

texts.en: Binti is a single mother with two children. They help her in the grocery store. Binti gained experience in commerce through her previous job as a salesperson at a private business. With the help of a loan, she invested. She currently has a well-stocked small grocery store. The items she sells the most are basic food items. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, drinks and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as flour, sugar, cooking oil, chicken, beef, drinks and dairy products, for her grocery store.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 48 years old, a hard-working and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her son and a daughter. Her husband is deceased, and her son has been engaged in the marble business for four years. Zainab has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The main purpose of loan is to permit her son to expand his business. He would purchase a large quantity, and new designs, of marble from other cities and then sell it at a profit. With the profits, Zainab wants to save money for the marriage of her daughter. This loan could fulfill her dreams, and she has great hopes for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity and variety of marble for her son's business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: This is Emma. She is in her late forties and is from Tombo, in western rural Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and has five children between the ages of 3 and 15. Emma runs a food stand in her neighborhood; she sells biscuits, milk, soap, cigarettes and sugar. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation. Emma has applied for a loan in order to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, such as milk, soap, cigarettes and sugar. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate the roof of her house. In the future, she plans to open a big shop. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of foodstuffs, such as milk, soap, cigarettes and sugar, for her food stall.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam is 26 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past year, Adam has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread. To help expand his business, Adam has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items, such as rice, maize flour and soda, to sell, and it will help Adam to generate greater profits and enable him to sell more goods, due to his increased stock. His profits will increase, and he will pay his medical bills. Adam hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his shop into a mini supermarket. Adam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Adam, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as rice, maize flour and soda, to sell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom attend school. Mwaka owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees. Mwaka operates a business selling firewood, selling from her home to her neighbours and to passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood-seller businesses. With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children. Hazem is the sole provider in the family.

Hazem owns a small shop and specializes in selling car accessories such as speakers, radios and amplifiers. After working with one of his relatives in this field and gaining sufficient experience, Hazem decided to open a similar business of his own in another area. In 2011, Hazem successfully established his business, and now he has hired an employee.

Hazem is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his shop by installing new shelves and an external ceiling. He believes that with the improvements enabled by this loan, he will be able to attract more customers and grow his business. By his income, Hazem will be able to cover all of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to renovate his shop by installing new shelves and an external ceiling

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis, tiene 34 años vive con su pareja con la que tienen  tres hijos de las edades de 1, 9 y 15 años, todos se encuentran estudiando, El Sr. Luis  se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace más de 11 años, ellos viven en la comunidad de cañaveral  Distante a 40 km. del Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que han solicitado es para la siembra de sorgo y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra, este sorgo lo venden como forraje para alimento del ganado Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo del productor al consumidor en el mercado de la zona, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Luis is 34 years old.  He lives with his partner, with whom he has three children who are 1, 9, and 15 years old and who are all in school.  Luis has been working in farming and livestock for over 11 years.  They live in the community of Cañaveral, 40km from El Torno, where their plot of land is and where they grown watermelons, citrus, and yucca.  The loan they have requested is to plant sorghum and for the cost of preparing the land.  They sell the sorghum as feed for livestock.  They sell everything they grow directly from grower to consumer at the local market.  He is happy with the institution and thankful for the help he has received.

loans.use: to plant sorghum

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 44 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en una colonia que pertenece al municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella lleva tres años de dedicarse a la elaboración de bisutería como aretes, cadenas, anillos, pulseras de piedras y también vende cosméticos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y en su casa. Ha decidido por solicitar un segundo préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar materiales para elaborar bisutería como ser piedras, hilos, broches y otros y va comprar lociones para vender. Ella quiere mantener surtido su negocio para mejorar las ventas. su plan es mejorar la situación económica familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 44 years old. She has two children and lives in a community in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Sandra has been making and selling jewelry for three years. She makes earrings, chains, rings, bracelets with stones, as well as sells cosmetics. She sells her merchandise door to door and from her home. 

Sandra decided to request a second loan of 5,000 Honduran Lempiras so that she will be able to buy supplies for her jewelry-making such as stones, threads, clasps, and others. She also plans to buy lotions to sell. Sandra hopes to keep her business stocked in order to increase her sales. She plans to help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy materials such as stones, threads, clasps, and others for making jewelry as well as to buy lotions to sell.

loans.name: Janet Jhovana

texts.es:
Janet es una mujer de 27 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Janet no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Janet trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Janet se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de andamios y bebidas, como refresco, agua mineral y otros, de esta manera Janet podrá exhibir mejor sus productos y tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada y segura, que brinde mayor bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Janet is a 27-year-old woman who lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and their two small children. She loves her family very much and they are her biggest motivation in live. Janet is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, alongside her husband, dedicates herself completely to helping her family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to scarce economic resources, Janet had to begin working at an early age and was not able to study a professional career as she would have liked to do.

In her free time, she enjoys listening to music. On special occasions, she cooks the delicious Lomo Saltado (sautéed beef tips) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Janet runs her own small grocery store. She works 10-hour days each day and believes that her success so far is due to the variety of products she offers and the kind way she treats her customers. 

Janet is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help her to buy more shelving and soft drinks such as juice, water, and others. This will help Janet to display her products better and keep her store stocked. Janet plans to continue working hard to achieve her dream of owning an adequate and safe house that will keep improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy shelving and soft drinks.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a hardworking and diligent 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and five children. Her husband is a government employee but his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. All of her children are studying in government schools. 

Zahida is an efficient beautician by profession. Since 2010, she has operated her own beauty salon. Currently the stock of beauty supplies of the salon is almost depleted, therefore Zahida wants to purchase cosmetic products to continue her business. For that purpose she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products like facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and some other varieties of products. She would also like to buy some new chairs for her salon. 

With the resulting profit, she will pay the installments of the loan and school fees for her children. She dreams to live a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and she has one child who attends school.

Gloria has been working as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes for women, men, and children since 2009. She has an established clientele.

Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jeans, other clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students. Since a new school term is approaching, she wants to continue making good sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory of jeans, clothes for men and women, and uniforms for elementary and high school students.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco tiene 53 años, casado con dos hijos mayores de 18 años,  el se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir desde hace ya varios años el confecciona ropa quirófano, batas para doctores,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que es en la en la zona de Vino Tinto. este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Francisco va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que el tiene contratos con hospitales a los que entrega el producto terminado,  como también entrega a distintas ferias donde venden ropa,  El Sr. Francisco enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes, El Sr. Francisco es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Francisco is 53 years old.  He is married with two children who are over 18.  He sews garments for a living and for years has been making surgical scrubs and doctors coats.  His workshop is in his home, which is in the Vino Tinto neighborhood.  This loan will be his first cycle with the institution.  Francisco will use this loan to buy bulk fabric to make clothing.  He is asking for this loan to increase his investment capital as he has contracts with hospitals where he delivers his finished product.  He also supplies different fairs where clothing is sold.  Francisco faces challenges in his business, such as increasing his profit, and he is going to use his earnings to invest in high quality sewing materials so he will get more orders from his customers.  Francisco is a very hardworking person.  He is happy with the institution and thankful for the help he has received.

loans.use: to buy fabric in bulk

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven Jose no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jose trabaja como operario en una empresa agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja desempeñando labores de campo y puede hacerlo todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, adicionalmente Jose tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes,  el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jose se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor variedad de cuyes, así como materiales de construcción (alambres, madera, malla metálica y otros) los cuales le servirán de mucho, ya que desea construir un corral adecuado para sus animales, de esta manera Jose seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jose is a 21-year-old man who lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Imperial, along with his wife and their young son. Jose's son is his biggest motivation in life. Jose is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate themselves completely to helping their family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to scarce economic resources, he had to begin working at an early age and was not able to study Auto Mechanics like he hoped to. 

In his free time, Jose likes to play soccer with his friends and, on special occasions, he cooks the delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a traditional Peruvian dish) to share with his family. 

By his own initiative and with much dedication and determination, Jose works in an agricultural business in his city. He works 10-hour days in the fields and also runs his own small business raising and selling guinea pigs. He enjoys this work and believes he has been successful because of his work ethic and the kind way he treats others. 

Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help him to buy a variety of guinea pigs, as well as building materials (cables, wood, hammer, and others) he needs to build a pen for his animals. In this way, Jose will continue working hard to achieve his dream of one day studying a professional career.

loans.use: to build a pen and buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La Sra. Josefa tiene 57 años, casada tiene un  hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de polleras y enaguas  para la mujeres de polleras, tiene su puesto de venta  en la zona de  Alto Lima, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Josefa va a usar este préstamo para la compra de polleras por mayor  para surtir su mercadería, ya que por esta fechas tiene mucha venta también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de El Alto,  La Sra. Josefa enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios e seguir comprando por mercadería por mayor para surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Josefa is 57 years old, married, and has one school-age child.  She sells skirts and underskirts for women.  She has a stall in the Alto Lima area.  This loan is her first cycle with the institution.  Josefa is going to use her loan to buy skirts in bulk to increase her stock, as her sales are very good this time of year.  She also fills orders with different markets in the city of El Alto.  Josefa faces challenges in her business, such as stocking up on merchandise, and she will use her earnings to keep buying merchandise in bulk to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy skirts in bulk

loans.name: Fidel Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Fidel  tiene 51 años, casado tiene un hijo que tienen la edad de 15 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Cohana, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Fidel  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Fidel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Fidel is 51 years old. He married with one 15-year-old son. He makes a living from the production and sale of cheese and milk since he has cattle. He lives in the locality of Cohana. The people of Cohana make a living from agriculture and farming. 

This loan is his first cycle with the institution. Fidel will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and he wants to make the most of this opportunity. The reason he is requesting this loan is because he has no money to make the purchase. The loan will benefit him greatly since the new dairy cow will give him a great quantity of milk, thereby allowing him to produce more cheese and milk and improve his income. 

Fidel faces challenges in his business, such as having to buy fodder every so often, and he will use the profits to improve his herd. His wish is to be able to make cheeses wholesale and offer them to different markets in the city of La Paz.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare the land for his new corn crop

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis  tiene 55 años es casado, tiene 1 hija, es de la ciudad  de Paraguarí,  allí el, su hija y su esposa Irene viven desde hace muchos años.
Luis tiene una despensa bien surtida, con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte de que ya cuenta con una clientela formada, siempre trata de ser una persona amable con sus clientes, y es por eso que le va muy bien, ya que sabe que la clave es ser servicial con las demás personas.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de bebidas, productos de limpieza, artículos comestibles, ya que de esta manera podrá aumentar y obtener un mayor ingreso y también seguir dando una buena variedad a sus clientes, de la misma forma que lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Luis is 55 years old, married, and has one daughter. He is from the city of Paraguarí. Luis, his daughter, and his wife Irene have lived there for many years.

He has a well-stocked food pantry that generates a good monthly income. Luis also has an established clientele and always tries to treat each of his customers in a friendly manner. For this reason, he has done very well. He knows that the key is being helpful to others.

Luis intends to use the loan to buy beverages, cleaning products, and food products. This will allow him to grow and generate more income. He also wants to continue offering a good variety to his customers in the same manner as he has done before.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cleaning products, and food products.

loans.name: Geraldine Fiorella

texts.es:
Geraldine es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja, a quien ama y con quien desea en poco tiempo tener su familia, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por  falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar, Geraldine no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Geraldine trabaja como operaria en una empresa pesquera de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de  8 horas y puede realizar labores de recojo, lavado, empaque de pescados, ella cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Geraldine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su habitación, ya que actualmente vive en casa de los padres de su pareja y su habitación se encuentra actualmente deteriorada y necesita reforzarla con materiales adecuado y resistentes, de esta manera Geraldine y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a 21-year-old woman who lives in the city of Chincha with her husband, whom she loves and with whom she hopes to soon start a family. Geraldine is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who strives to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to financial hardship, Geraldine had to begin working at a young age and was not able to study Business Administration like she had hoped to. 

In her free time, she likes to watch movies and, on special occasions, she cooks the delicious Arroz con Pato (a Peruvian dish with duck and rice) to share with her family. 

By her own initiative and with much determination and dedication, Geraldine works at a fishing company in her city. She works eight-hour days, every day, doing jobs such as gathering, cleaning, and packing fish. She believes that she has been successful because she is very responsible and is friendly to everyone around her. 

Geraldine is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help her to improve her home. Currently, she lives in her in-laws' house and her room is deteriorating and in need of repairs. She needs to buy better materials to do the repairs so that her family will be safer and healthier. Geraldine plans to continue working hard to achieve her dream of one day owning her own house.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. Él está acompañado, tiene tres  hijos de edades 1, 6 y 10 años; ya posee 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad y esto lo aprendió con sus padres, lo realiza de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm, dependiendo de la temporada.
El préstamo que solicita lo necesitara para comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y plaguicidas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Esta inversión le permitirá adquirir todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios de una sola vez y con las ganancias ayudar a su familia.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos en los estudios y que no falte la alimentación para el hogar.
texts.en:
José grows corn and beans.  He has a spouse and three children, ages one, six, and ten.  He has been working at this business activity for 20 years.  He leaned it from his parents.  He works from 6:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m., depending upon the season.

He needs the loan he is requesting to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides for his corn and bean crops.  This investment will allow him to get all of the needed agricultural supplies at the same time.  He will help his family with the profits.

His objective is to help his children with their education and to make sure there is food in the home.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old youth client from Iraq. He is married and has 2 children.

Ali is a grocer. He sells soft drinks, juices, detergents, and dairy products. In 2011, when there was no grocery store in the neighborhood, Ali took the opportunity to open one. He gained a good reputation thanks to his good thinking in providing the basic needs for the neighborhood. Ali has gained good experience in this field.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store and to renovate it. He is aiming to grow his business more and increase his revenues, so he will be able to take care of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to renovate and pay the annual rent of his grocery store.

loans.name: Jabu

texts.en:
Jabu is a merchant. She makes a living selling mainly fruits and vegetables. She has done this work for more than 3 years, and she has a place in a popular market in Kisauni where she sells fresh products to her customers every day.

She's a very hardworking person who makes an effort every day, from very early in the morning, because she begins her work day very early.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables so she can continue working and giving her customers good products.

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
El Sr. Cipriano es originario de la ciudad de Monclova pero tiene viviendo en la ciudad de Piedras Negras desde hace 30 años, es un hombre casado y padre de tres hijos. Es profesor de secundaria, donde imparte la materia de carpintería, además de dar mantenimiento en la misma escuela en donde tiene 23 años de estar laborando.
El Sr. Cipriano es dueño de una pequeña carpintería que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio, es una persona muy emprendedora que no se conforma con un solo ingreso, siempre esta ideando como generar más  para que a su familia nunca le haga falta nada.
El próposito es que su carpintería crezca más y más para poder ofrecersela en un futuro a sus hijos y su esposa.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder terminar un cuarto de baño en una esquina de su carpintería ya que pasa mucho ahí dentro, poco  a poco irá remodelando para que ese lugar luzca muy agradable al momento que llegan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cipriano is originally from the city of Monclova, but he has had a home in the city of Piedras Negras for 30 years. He is a married man and is the father of three children. He is a teacher at a secondary school, where he teaches carpentry. He also does maintenance work at the same school and has worked there for 23 years.

Cipriano is the owner of a small furniture store located in his home. He is a very enterprising person who does not content himself with only one form of income. He is always thinking up ways to generate more income so that his family never lacks anything. 

His intention is for his furniture store to grow more and more in order to provide a future for his children and his wife.

He is asking for help through Kiva in order to be able to finish a bathroom in a corner of his furniture store since he spends a lot of time in there. He is going to remodel his store a little at a time so that it will leave a favorable impression on his clients.

loans.use: to build a bathroom

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Don Santiago, tiene 41 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos,  vive con su familia en San Juan Pueblo. El establecio un negocio de pulperia en este negocio vende granos básicos, huevos, lácteos, harina, embutidos,  condimentos, productos de limpieza, pastas, refrescos, etc. el negocio tiene ocho años de funcionar y tiene buena clientela. El está solicitando un préstamo por 25,000 Lempiras para surtir más el negocio de productos alimenticios,como granos basicos, productos de limpieza, carnes, lacteos, embutidos etc.  con el fin de aumentar las ventas. Su meta es seguir creciendo y llegar a graduar sus hijos y ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Don Santiago is 41 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his family in San Juan Pueblo.

Santiago established a grocery business where he sells basic grains, eggs, dairy products, flour, cured meats, condiments, cleaning products, pastas, soft drinks, and other items. His business has been in operation for eight years and has a good clientele.

Santiago is requesting a loan of 25,000 HNL so that he can restock his store with more products such as basic grains, cleaning products, meats, dairy products, cured meats, and other items so that he can increase his sales. His goals are to keep growing, see his children graduate, and help his family financially.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, meats, dairy products, cured meats, and other items.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 49-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has 3 children. The youngest child is 6 while the oldest child is 21. She is into farming. She grows rice. She has been growing rice 20 years. 

Sabina's income is meager enough to meet the family's expenses, so she requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seedlings to increase the volume of harvest as well as increase sales. 

In the future, Sabina would like to invest in another business to support her family and to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and rice seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and food stock for her cafe business.

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda en su municipio, actividad que según ella le deja buenas ganancias y le permite sostener su hogar. La idea surgió gracias a su hermana quien la motivó. Sus principales clientes son las personas del campo, por lo cual María solo abre los fines de semana. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía, ya que esta inversión le permitirá mejorar su condición económica e incrementar su volumen de ventas. 
A futuro la señora María desea tener su propia vivienda para garantizarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and sells secondhand clothing in her town. According to María, her business generates good income and allows her to sustain her household. She came up with this idea thanks to her sister who encouraged her. Her main customers are farm workers since María is only open on the weekends.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. This investment will allow her to improve her financial condition and increase her sales volume. In the future, Sra. María wants to have her own house so that she can guarantee that her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Victor,  tiene 46  años de edad, vive en condiciones desfavorables ya que la producción agrícola en la zona no tiene riego, por tanto la producción es únicamente dependiente de las precipitaciones pluviales de la época;   tiene seis  hijos dependientes que asisten a la escuela de Mizque, por lo general los niños deben caminar para llegar a su escuela y en algunas ocasiones en vehículos que transitan por casualidad esas rutas.  Su esposa es la señora Juana, tiene 46 años, Juana colabora en la producción agrícola y el manejo del ganado vacuno. Debido a  las riadas ocasionadas por las tormentas en la segunda semana de febrero, los cultivos de Victor fueron afectados en gran parte, ya que perdió el 50% de su producción de arveja y papa, afectando una disminución de ingresos económicos por venta de estos productos. Por todo lo anteriormente mencionado la estabilidad económica de Victor  sufrió un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de los materiales escolares e insumos requeridos para la construcción de vivienda y  de la canasta familiar para la alimentación de su familia. Para enmendar lo mencionado anteriormente ha recurrido al crédito para comprar  semillas de (zanahoria, cebolla), agroquímicos y abono orgánico; de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida y estabilizar las necesidades económicas de su familia y retomar el camino de la prosperidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor, age 46, lives in conditions that are unfavorable for farming since his area has no irrigation. Therefore, his crops are dependent only on the seasonal rainfall. He has six dependent children who attend school in Mizque. In general, the children must walk to school, but on some occasions they will catch a ride on vehicles that are traveling in the same direction. His wife is Sra. Juana, age 46. She helps with the farm production and with taking care of the cattle.

Due to floods that resulted from the storms during the second week of February, Victor’s crops were negatively impacted. He lost half of his pea and potato crops, resulting in less income from the sale of these products. This direct hit to his finances affected his ability to buy school supplies, construction materials for his home, and food so that his family could eat. To rectify this problem, Victor is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds (onions and carrots), agrochemicals, and organic fertilizer. This will enable him to generate more income that will improve his quality of life and stabilize his family’s finances. As a result, they can resume their path to prosperity.

loans.use: to buy seeds (onions and carrots), agrochemicals, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 32-year-old hard working housewife. She is living in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters and one son. Her husband has been driving a taxi for eight years and this is the only source of income for her family. 
Right now there is a lot of repairing and tuning work required in the engine of the taxi.  Because of that, it’s almost impossible for him to get earnings . Farhat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, to pay for repairing the engine of her husband's taxi so that he can drive it properly. With the profit, her husband would buy one more taxi in the future.  Farhat wishes to provide a quality education for her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To meet the amount for taxi repairing

loans.name: Jacqueline Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Jacqueline vive en Guayaquil (orquídeas), tiene 42 años de edad. Empezó cuando se quedo sin trabajo, y decidió poner una recicladora, porque vio que no mucha gente reciclaba Y por donde ella vive no hay muchos lugares para reciclar y fue asi que puso su propio negocio.

Ella actualmente es recicladora y realiza su trabajo sola, ella pesa los productos reciclables que le llegan, trabaja desde la mañana hasta la noche. Las dificultades que ella tiene en su trabajo es la enfermedad de sus hijos. Ella no está casada  y tiene 3 hijos, uno mayor de edad y los otros estudian en escuela fiscales.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar fundas, cartones para reclicar las botellas. Sus sueños para el futuro son de hacer su casa de cemento, que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Jacqueline is 42 years old and lives in Guayaquil (Orquídeas). She started her business after she lost her job. Jacqueline decided to open a recycling center because she saw that not many people recycle. In the area where she lives, there are not many places that recycle, which influenced her to open her own business.

Jacqueline currently manages her recycling center by herself. She weighs the recyclable products that come in, which keeps her busy from morning to night. The difficulties she faces in her business include having to take care of her children when they are sick. Jacqueline is not married and has three children, one grown child and two others who attend state schools.

She will use this loan to buy bags and cardboard that she can use for recycling bottles. Her dreams for the future include building a cement house, seeing her children continue their studies, and continuing to operate her business.

loans.use: to buy bags and cardboard.

loans.name: Shani

texts.en: Shani is a hardworking woman who intends to prosper in her business.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water and she would like to apply for a loan of kshs 40,000.  She wants to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. The more items displayed at the store, the better.  More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Marcelo Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcelo vive en La Libertad, el tiene 42 años de edad.  Su historia empieza cuando él decide  vender sal en el sector para tener ingresos para poder pagar los gastos del hogar y como le fue bien con las ventas empezó a ampliar más sus recorridos por el sector, vendiendo sal en fundas. 

El realiza su trabajo junto a su esposa, todos los días de la semana. La única dificultad que se presenta en su negocio es el transporte, se le hace muy pesado la movilización de su mercadería y también la distancia que hay que caminar, es muy cansado para los dos. El está casado, su esposa también vende sal. El tiene hijos pero todos ya son mayores. 

El usara el préstamo para comprar quintales de sal y poder vender a mas clientes. Sus sueños para el futuro son de poder tener su propia microempresa de sal..
texts.en:
Sr. Marcelo is 42 years old and lives in La Libertad. His story begins when he decided to sell salt in his neighborhood as a way of generating income for the household expenses. He did very well with his sales, so he expanded to other parts of the area, selling bags of salt.

Marcelo and his wife work together every day of the week. The only difficulty he faces in his business is the lack of transportation. The merchandise is very heavy. Since they must travel by foot, Marcelo and his wife are usually very tired. He is married and his wife also sells salt. They have children, but all of them are grown.

Marcelo will use this loan to buy salt by the quintal (1 quintal = 100 kg) so that he can sell to more customers. His dreams for the future include having his own salt micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy salt in bulk.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 31-year-old Hawa from western rural Tombo in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 1 year and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2003, Hawa established her clothing business. She began her business because she wants to support herself and move forward with her family. She works at the business 11 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is that transportation is very difficult.

Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. In the future, Hawa plans to open a clothing shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a cereal selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces major challenges of high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jaseb

texts.en:
Jaseb is a 48-year-old Iraqi client who is married and has 2 children. Jaseb and one of his children provide the income of the family together.

Jaseb owns a small grocery store selling drinks, snacks, detergents, and dairy products. He has been in this field for more than 10 years, but established his own business in his neighborhood in 2008. Jaseb gained good experience in this field and, since he is the only grocer in the area, his fame grew fast in the surroundings.

Jaseb is requesting a loan of $2,400 to buy two new refrigerators and a motor generator. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators and a motor generator.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi youth client who is single and lives with his family consisting of 5 members. Ali and his brother are the only providers in the family.

Ali is 18 years old and he is a grocer. He sells all the daily necessities of a family such as juices, soft drinks, snacks, detergents, perfumes, and dairy products. 

In 2010, Ali’s father helped him to establish this business and after seeing Ali’s potential, he let Ali run the shop all by himself. Ali has gained a good reputation in his surroundings thanks to his management ability since his young age.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD. He will use this loan to install a display window and an external ceiling. Ali aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to take care of his parents and provide for all of their needs.

loans.use: to install a display window and an external ceiling in his shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t financially support additional family members. 

Josephine has a business selling used clothes, and she has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. This business is her only income-generating activity.   

Josephine sells the used clothes door-to-door seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of used clothes. She aspires to establish a permanent business premises and to become a wholesaler. She also aspires to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house ,and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hard working and determined man. He will use this loan to pay tuition for his two sons, one at university and the other at a technical institution. 

The previous loans helped him pay for tuition for his children through secondary school up to this level. He is so thankful to UGAFODE for supporting him in changing the status of his family by having educated children. He also thanks Kiva lenders for partnering with him.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his two sons.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para estar preparado para la temporada de invierno para así comprar insumos agrícolas   y mejorar la vivienda. Este le permitirá adquirir abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, semilla, preparar la tierra, entre otros gastos. 
El crédito anterior le permitió cultivar las manzanas de tierra que deseaba y logro cancelar el alquiler del terreno. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen, los ingresos han mejorado; su deseo es seguir trabajando en el cultivo para mejorar la vivienda, sacar a sus hijos adelante y después  poseer otro tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
María is requesting a new loan in order to prepare for the winter season by purchasing agricultural supplies and improving her house.  This will allow her to get manure, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, and seeds.  It will allow her to prepare the land and pay for other expenses.

The previous loan allowed her to cultivate the land that she wanted to, and she managed to pay the rent for the land.  Her family circumstances have remained constant, and the income has improved.

Her wish is to continue working with the crops in order to improve her home, to get her children ahead, and to later have another type of business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to improve her house.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 38 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 months and 15 years old. They attend school and live at home. 

She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and others items for the past two years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and others items for her business.

In the near future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and others items for her business.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro, solicita un nuevo préstamo porque necesita invertir en la producción de granos básicos. Este le permitirá comprar abono y semilla de maíz.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la producción, incrementaron los ingresos, estos los invirtió en los gastos del hogar. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, asimismo las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Alvaro is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest in his production of basic grains. He will be able to buy compost and corn seeds.

His previous loan helped with increasing his production and his earnings. The profits were invested in his household expenses. His family’s circumstances have improved, as well as their financial condition.

loans.use: to buy compost and corn seeds.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Doña Dora se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años siembra frijol y maiz ella comercializa sus cultivos en los mercados de su lugar de residencia y con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos. Ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Dora has been farming fro 20 years. She plants beans and corn to sell in local markets. Her sales cover the household expenses. She is responsible, honest, and hardworking. She lives with her husband and five children.

She has applied for a loan to buy supplies for the harvest because her earnings will not cover these expenses. She will then have more income and greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (seed, fertilizer, etc)

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
This is Paula. She previously received an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Paula hopes that her business will be bigger and more profitable. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Sitha is 23 years old and married with two children who are still small. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and growing cassava. They have engaged in this business for three years, and together they can earn about KHR 18,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 7,000 each day for future needs. 

This is the second loan for Sitha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other member is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sitha wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor to plow the field. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is household consumables.

For the past one year, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a video camera.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: La Sra. Aydee tiene 49 años y tiene  tres hijos que tienen las  edades de 15, 13 y 9 años, que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de variedad de repostería en panadería, ella tiene su tienda  que se encuentra en la zona de Santiago de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Aydee va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de insumos como harina azúcar y levadura para la elaboración de galletas, empanadas y tortas,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Aydee enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que existe en la zona como también la  de mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para incrementar su producción, se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le b rindan en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Aydee is 49-years-old and has three children that are 15, 13, and 9 years old. Her children are of school age. Aydee works in the creation and sale of a variety of pastries in a bakery.  She has her store in the zone of Santiago in the city of El Alto. 

This loan is her first with this institution. Aydee will use this loan to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar, and yeast to make cookies empanadas, and cakes. The reason she is requesting this loan is because she is lacking capital for her work. Aydee encounters obstacles such as competition in her neighborhood and the desire to improve her quality of life. She will use her profits to increase her production. She is happy for the opportunity that is provided to her with the loan since it is the only way she can support herself.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to create pastries

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su hijo y su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposo, su hijo y un nieto, es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol desde hace 30 años. Juana desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Juana is very responsible when it comes to her household commitments. She has always tried to offer her son and family the best. She lives with her husband, son, and grandson. She happily and eagerly works hard. Each of the past 30 years, she has planted basic local grain crops like corn and beans.
 
Juana wants to increase sales and has applied for a loan to buy seed, manure, fertilizer, pesticide, and more. She hopes to obtain this loan because she does not have any other cash income. This way, she will continue to support her household without a problem.

loans.use: to buy planting supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 50 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su hijo. vive en casa propia con su hijo de 17 años, Don Daniel se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol desde hace 20 años, el desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Daniel, 50, is a man who very responsible with his household obligations, because he has always been known for providing the best for his son.  He lives in his own home with his 17 year-old son.   Daniel is a farmer who has been cultivating corn and beans for 20 years.  He wants to increase his sales, and so to do this he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies.  This way, he can continue to bring daily sustenance to his household.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es: Doña Fidelina de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive con sus 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de aluminio como ollas, vasos, tenedores, sartenes entre otras cosas, también vende producto de limpieza, tiene 14 años con el negocio y ha adquirido mucha experiencia en la venta que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, ella vende en una zona muy transitada por las personas,tiene mucha clientela por la calidad del producto que comercializa es una mujer muy trabajadora quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar productos de aluminio y productos de limpieza, para poder seguirle dando lo mejor a sus hijos y solventar los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en: Fidelina, 49, is a single mother who lives with her 2 children.  She has a business selling aluminum products such as: pots, cups, forks, frying pans, and other items.  She also sells cleaning products.  She's had this business for 14 years, over which time she has acquired a lot of sales experience which enables her to obtain the best earnings.  She sells in a neighborhood where there are many passers-by, and she has a lot of customers because of the quality products that she sells.   Fidelina is a very hardworking woman who wants to make a new investment in her business.  This is why she is requesting a loan to buy aluminum products and cleaning products.  This way, she will be able to continue to give the best to her children and cover her expenses.

loans.use: to buy aluminum products such as pots and pans

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo
