texts.es: Don Carlos de 47 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años siembra maiz y maicillo con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa quien vende verdura en el mercado cerca de su lugar de residencia y sus 4 hijos quienes estudian actualmente. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos para su cosecha y poder pager el alquiler de la parcela donde siembra sus cultivos ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Carlos, 47, has been farming for 20 years. He plants corn and sorghum, and sales from the harvest cover his household expenses. He is responsible, honest, and hardworking. He lives with his wife, who sells vegetables in a nearby market. His four children are students.

He has applied for a loan to buy supplies for the harvest and to pay the rent on the land he plants. His earnings do not cover these expenses, and this way he will have more income and greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to rent land.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is single and lives with her mother. Charity is a young entrepreneur who started working at a very young age with her mother in a small cafeteria they have nearby. Since she is the oldest sister, she had to help with the upkeep of the house along with her mother. With a lot of effort, she studied hairdressing and manicure and received the best grades. She performs her services in-home, offering her customers comfort and professionalism at a good price. She reports that it is going well with her established clientele because they are all very busy people who don't have time to wait for hours in beauty salons.

She is requesting a loan, which she wants to invest in buying a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener, which will help her a lot in her work. She very much appreciates the assistance that she is receiving, since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy a professional hair dryer and a hair straightener.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Matilde Rosa Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Matilde cuenta con 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Juárez, N.L. al oriente del área metropolitana. Actualmente la Sra. Matilde tiene una estética al frente de su domicilio la cual ha construido con mucho sacrificio, dedicándose a este oficio desde hace mas de 4 años sin embargo no había podido establecerse de manera mas formal por diversas circunstancias, sin embargo hoy en día gracias al apoyo de su esposo ha logrado edificar un local que le permite continuar con sus planes de crecimiento, además se encuentra estudiando pedagogía, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse en otro ámbito.
La Sra. Matilde comenta que esto lo ha logrado gracias a los créditos que ha tenido en credituyo y que el nuevo crédito le servirá para realizarle unas reparaciones en el techo que le permita una mejor imagen a su negocio además de comprar unos muebles y persianas que le permitan tener un lugar mas fresco y cómodo sobre todo en estos tiempos de calor.
Comenta la Sra. Matilde que uno de sus sueños es poder tener 2 o 3 estéticas para poder generar fuentes de empleo y que a ella le permita dedicarse a la docencia y poder ayudar a la gente de otra manera.
texts.en:
Matilde is 25 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She lives in the municipality of Juarez, Nuevo Leon, to the east of the metropolitan area.  Matilde now has a salon in the front of her home, which she built with a lot of sacrifice.  She has been working as a hair stylist for more than 4 years; however, she had not been able to establish herself in a more formal business due to various circumstances.  But today, thanks to the support of her husband, she has managed to build a salon, which will allow her to continue with her plans to grow her business.  In addition, she is studying in the field of education, which is allowing her to develop in another area.

Matilde comments that she has achieved all of this thanks to some loans that she has taken from Credituyo.  This new loan will help her to make some repairs to her roof, improving the appearance of her business.  She will also buy some furniture and blinds so that she can have a place that is more cool and comfortable, particularly during the seasons when it is hot.

Matilde comments that one of her dreams is to be able to have 2 or 3 beauticians so that she can generate a source of employment.  This would allow her to devote herself to teaching, enabling her to help people in another way.

loans.use: to make some repairs to her salon: finish the walls and waterproof the roof

loans.name: Priscille's Group

texts.en:
“Mugambimwiza” is a word meaning “good plan” in English. Led by Donatha, the group sells different items and they are very dedicated members because all of them see and have a hope for better future business.  

Donatha is 23 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy more rice and cassava for sale. She is planning to use the profits for providing food for the family and making more savings. 

In the picture, Donatha is putting up her hand so that she becomes identifiable from other group members as the group leader.

loans.use: to buy more rice and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1978. She has two daughters and a son. They are really young – age 5, 3 and really little. Her husband is a worker. His income is about 6,000,000 dong (VND). Thuy does carpentry to earn a living. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. Her family’s total earnings are about 11,000,000 VND per month.

Thuy has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She always wants to enlarge her workshop and raise her children up well.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de flores artificiales. Este le permitirá comprar flores, listones, pega, entre otros productos, con esto obtener ingresos para brindarle ayuda a su familia y asimismo adquirir cinco quintales de maíz para el sustento diario, ya que con el crédito anterior no logro adquirir utilidades y por ello no han cambiado las condiciones económicas ni las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: María has applied for a new loan to continue investing in her artificial flower business. She will buy flowers, slats, glue, and other items so that she can earn income to support her family. She will also buy five sacks of corn to make food, since she was unable to generate profits or improve her family's financial situation and circumstances with the prior loan.

loans.use: to buy flowers, slats, glue, and other items.

loans.name: Jeimy Cristina

texts.es: En este momento vive junto a su familia padres, y hermanos los cuales se apoyan mutuamente para confrontar cualquier problema hace  1 año se graduó de bachiller y está dispuesta a estudiar para salir adelante por su hijo y su futuro. Su hijo ya va a cumplir 2 años y quiere poder cumplir todos sus sueños, al igual que con su familia. Ella inicia su programa de enfermería como ayuda en su futuro de carrera profesional, logrando así abrir muchas puertas en diferentes compañías y empresas de la salud.  Esta carrera de enfermería me agrada ya que es la manera de ayudar y colaborar a mucha gente que puede necesitar de ella, brindando apoyo en momentos de dificultades, con los pacientes y familiares.
texts.en:
At the moment, the borrower is living with her family, which includes her parents and siblings. They support one another whenever they confront any problem. She graduated from high school last year and is willing to study so that she can help her child move forward and provide for their future. Her child will turn two years old and she wants to fulfill all of their dreams, as well as those of her family.

The borrower started the nursing program because a professional degree will be helpful in the future. This will open doors to different companies and businesses in the health care field. She is grateful to have the chance to pursue a nursing degree because it will enable her to help and work with many people who need her. She will be able to provide support to patients and their family members during difficult moments.

loans.use: to finish her nursing degree program.

loans.name: Nhoeb's Group

texts.en: A 47 year old mother of three schoolchildren, Nhoeb is an inhabitant from Takeo province’s Samrong district. She deals with the financial burden of the family's daily food consumption via weaving silk and farming rice, which is the business that she has been with for 30 years. She earns about 18,500 KHR per day. Nhoeb is not a first time borrower with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She has improved her lifestyle effectively from past loans which she has completely repaid back. Now, in the group of three, she is the leader. The total requesting loan amount is 2,400,000 KHR, of which 700,000 KHR is Nhoeb's loan portion. For Nhoeb, she will use her loan portion to build a proper latrine for her household. She highly hopes that she can maintain a good health practice for her family, especially her kids.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman with seven children, and she lives in Kisauni. She has a fish business. She has been buying and selling fish for over ten years. She says that with great effort her business is growing, and she is equipping it little by little. She hopes to be able to have a great place of business. That way she will be able to also have better conditions for her customers.

She requested the loan to buy a freezer and a cooler. They will be extremely useful in transporting and conserving her product. She always wants to be able to give her customers fresh good quality products.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and a cooler.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is a 52 year old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 22 while the youngest is 17. She owns and operates a retail store in her community. She sells commodities like canned goods, noodles, condiments, soaps, beverages and soft drinks. She has been operating a retail store business for almost three years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy more merchandise to sell like eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and toiletries. Severina hopes that she will be successful in her business and will be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee and toiletries.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is grateful for the great financial boost he has received through Milango as a first loan. He added it to his savings and purchased a second hand motorcycle. The demand for such a means of transport is still quite high and he is therefore applying for a second loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to add and purchase a second motor cycle. He intends to save the additional income for future investments.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en:
Ny resides in Takeo Province, where silk weaving is the most popular business. She is 59 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She does silk weaving as her main source of income and rice farming for supplementary income. She has been involved in silk weaving for 30 years, earning about 8,000 Cambodian riels (KHR).

Ny has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before.  She now leads a group of three to apply for a latrine-construction loan. Ny will spend her entire portion, 600,000 KHR--the same amount as her co-borrowers--to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to have a proper latrine for her kids to prevent illness related to lack of hygienic practices.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, an inhabitant of Kror Kor district in Pursat Province, is 47 years old and a widow. To tackle the family’s hardship, she grows rice and sells Khmer noodles. Having been in this business for ages, she is able to earn up to 13,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. Yan is a two-cycle client of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan, which helped her to set aside some money to start up a new business.

The total amount of the group's loan is 3,100,000 KHR.  As the group leader, Yan will use her portion to buy more ingredients including flour and rice for her Khmer noodle-selling business. She strongly believes that she can make more income and maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy ingredients including flour and rice for her Khmer noodle-selling business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from Kisauni and operates a small hair salon. She wants to remodel her salon in order to offer her clients a more comfortable environment and generate more income to help support her family. She is requesting this loan to help grow her business.

Mariam is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has a lot of experience in her field and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to have a large beauty salon one day and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1955. She has an adult son and daughter. Her husband is a carpenter. His income is 5,000,000 VND. Thuy also does carpentry to earn a living. She makes 4,000,000 VND a month from her job. Her family’s total earnings are about 30,000,000 VND per month.
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy wood for her carpentry workshop. She has always wanted to save more money for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood for her carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 26 years old; she and her fiancé live in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her fiancé is a security personnel and they have three children between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. Only two of her children attend school and they all live at home. 

Since 2010, Marie has been selling biscuits, candy, bread, etc. to her community. Sometimes she has less customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, bread, etc. for her business. In the future she plans to send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, bread, etc. for her business

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is from Kisauni. She has her own house and lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She's a very hardworking, responsible, and honest woman. She started working in a retail shop as a shop attendant. Her dream has always been to have her own business and work independently to generate more income to improve her family's quality of life.

As time went by she began to sell household consumables in her own store and throughout the area. She acquired a lot of customers, expanded her store, started a well-stocked grocery store, and expanded her clientele and daily sales.

Halima is requesting this loan to be able to stock her store with necessity items such as noodles, rice, vegetables, meat, and other supplies, because this will help her continue with her sales.

loans.use: to stock her store with necessity items, such as noodles, rice, vegetables, meat, and other supplies

loans.name: Johnbull's Group

texts.en:
These are the members of a secondary school in Koidu. They want a loan of 6,600,000 SLL to help them meet their immediate needs. Some of the members want the loan in order to invest in business, some to pay their childrens' school fees, others to pay for school-related charges, and others would like to invest the loan in a house building project.

Yillah is a teacher at the school and is also the featured leader of this group. Yillah wants this loan in order to pay the school fees for his children. Yillah is a 55-year-old man, born in Tombodu, Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a teacher and they have four children who are attending secondary school. Yillah has been a professional teacher for 28 years now.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his children

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 34 years old and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. 

She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between seven to twenty years old, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past four years, Veronica has been selling palm oil and she started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business helps her save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sanitary items for selling

loans.name: Sang's Group

texts.en:
Sang, age 53 and married, is a silk weaver living in Takeo Province. Besides her handicraft business, she also helps her husband  to grow rice on two hectares during her spare time. Her current business earns her about 17,600 riels (KHR) per day. 

This is the fourth cycle for Sang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). From the past loan, which she has fully paid back, she feels so empowered to relieve her family's hardships and strengthen both her businesses in a gradual manner. Now she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her household. She hopes to own a proper latrine to improve sanitation practice for her family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine

loans.name: Jane Francis

texts.en:
Jane Francis is 50 years old and lives in the town of Buwama, Uganda. She has eight children, whose ages range from 11 to 32, as well as four grandchildren. Jane Francis is a widow and three of her children still live at home under her care. 

In addition to being a Solar Sister entrepreneur, Jane Francis works as a farmer to earn a living. She raises pigs and cows and grows maize, cassava, beans, bananas, and sweet potatoes. Solar Sisters are female entrepreneurs who sell solar-powered lanterns and phone charging to their communities. With this Kiva loan, Jane Francis will purchase more solar inventory that she will then resell to her community. 

Jane Francis loves being a Solar Sister because it helps her earn additional income to supplement her children's school fees. Her biggest motivations in selling solar lanterns are her own personal development and earning extra income. Jane Francis's biggest dream for the future is to build another home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar-powered lanterns to sell in her community

loans.name: Maria Jose Lina

texts.es: Doña Maria tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos y vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Hace 10 año que doña Maria ha puesto su propio negocio de venta de mercadería, vende ropa, zapatos, sandalias,etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y tambien hace sus ventas de manera ambulante ya tiene sus clientes fijos y le va muy bien con las ventas.Ella es cliente consecutiva de Odef.  Con el préstamo que solicita por 10,500 lempiras va comprar mercadería como sandalias, y ropa nueva para surtir el negocio, ya que teniendo su inventario con variedad de productos va incrementar las ventas. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y se mantenga activo porque es una fuente de ingresos de la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa. For the past 10 years, Doña Maria has managed her own business of selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, sandals, and other items. The business is in her home, but she also conducts sales as a traveling vendor. She has established customers and is doing very well with her sales.

Maria is a repeat client of ODEF. She is requesting a loan of 10,500 HNL so that she can buy merchandise, such as sandals and new clothing to restock her business. Having a variety of products in her inventory will increase her sales. Her plan is to grow her business and keep it active because it is the source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and sandals.

loans.name: Andrea Del Pilar

texts.es:
Su nombre es Andrea del Pilar. Es hija de una pareja emprendedora, feliz y con mucha fe en Dios. Andrea  es la segunda hija de este feliz matrimonio tuvo una infancia feliz y destaco en el colegio.
Esta pareja lleva 24 años juntos, eso ha demostrado que el amor lo puede todo, ella a sus dieciocho años valora mucho a sus padres, el esfuerzo y la moral que le han inculcado, a demás del buen ejemplo.

Hace dos años termino su bachillerato, se graduó con honores y cree que fue una muy buena experiencia, tiene recuerdos muy gratos de cada una de sus amigas, es una persona que ha dejado huella en la vida de muchas personas, ya que su carisma y don de gentes ha generado una empatía frente a sus docentes.
Después de terminar el colegio no tenían los recursos para la universidad, pero su mama con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro brindarle unos niveles de ingles los cuales ella desarrollo con éxito.     
Después de ello tomo la decisión de empezar a trabajar por temporadas decembrinas, le fue muy bien pero por cuestiones que no cabe mencionar se quedo sin empleo, pero por apoyo de su familia decide iniciar su vida estudiantes nuevamente. Al ver la situación que se encuentra pasando, ya que su papa hace 19 años desarrollo la enfermedad de la diabetes la cual ha creado degeneramiento en su organismo y debido a eso perdió la vista, con esto desarrollo también daños en sus riñones provocando un habito de diálisis cada tres días, desde entonces su mama se hizo cargo de la casa, ella de ahí en adelante se convierte en la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Andrea anhela terminar todos sus estudios, es consciente que los va a realizar con la ayuda de Dios, sabe que a largo plazo desarrollara su sueño de ser odontóloga, pero por ahora va a realizarse como Técnica en Cocina en la institución. 
Sueña con preparar algo delicioso y especial para alguien famoso o alguien muy especial para ella.
Espera tomar las clases y terminaras para poder aprender y salir adelante y  ser un apoyo para su familia.
texts.en:
Her name is Andrea del Pilar. She is the daughter of an entrepreneurial couple, she is happy, and with much faith in God. Andrea is the second daughter from this happy marriage. She had a happy childhood and did very well in high school. This couple has been together for 24 years, and this has shown that love will always triumph. At 18 years old, she values her parents very much, and also the hard work and morals they have taught her, and also the good example they have provided. 

Two years ago she finished her high school degree. She graduated with honors and it was a very good experience. She has wonderful memories of each of her friends. She has left her mark on the lives of many people. Her charisma and the fact she is a good person have made an impression on her teachers. 

After finishing high school, she didn’t have the resources to attend university. However, her mother, through a lot of hard work and dedication, was able to provide her with a few English classes, which she was very successful in. After that, she made the decision to start working during the December holidays. Things went very well for her, but for reasons that are not relevant here, she became unemployed. With the support of her family, she has decided to become a student again. She took a look at the situation in which she finds herself. Nineteen years ago, her father developed diabetes, which has caused degeneration of his body, and because of this he lost his sight. He has also developed damage to his kidneys, such that he has to go for dialysis every three days. From that time, her mother took charge of the household and became the source of income for the family. 

Andrea wants very much to finish her studies. She is aware that she will be able to do this, with God’s help. She is sure that over the long run, she will achieve her goal of becoming an orthodontist, but for now she will study Cooking Teqnique in the institution. 

She dreams of preparing something delicious and special for someone famous or someone that is very special for her. She hopes to take the classes and finish them so she can get ahead and help support her family.

loans.use: to finish her studies in Cooking.

loans.name: Silvia Yanira

texts.es:
Silvia,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir en la producción de granos básicos. Este le ayudara para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas y pago de mano de obra para realizar la siembra de maíz y frijol.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar los ingresos, incrementar la producción del cultivo; las utilidades que obtiene las utiliza para los gastos del hogar para así sacar adelante a su familia.   Las condiciones económicas crecieron gracias a la inversión que llevo a cabo con el crédito otorgado de Kiva.
texts.en:
Silvia is requesting a new loan because she needs to invest in the production of basic staples. This will help her buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, as well as pay for labor in order to plant corn and beans.

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her earnings and expand the production of her crops. The profits she earned were used for the household expenses, which allowed her family to get ahead. Her financial condition improved thanks to the investment of the loan granted by Kiva.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джура добросовестный и честный человек. Всю свою жизнь он прожил в своей родине, на юге солнечного Таджикистана. Он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и поэтому имеет большой опыт. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 9 детей. Более 20 лет он занимается скотоводством. Он имеет большое домохозяйство, так как обеспечение 9 детей требует много благ. Он самый честный и трудолюбивый бизнесмен на местном рынке. Он продает свой скот мясникам и другим людям. Благодаря, упорному труду он имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Джура планирует развивать бизнес дальше и поэтому он обратился за займом для покупки скота. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Jura is a conscientious and honest person. He has lived his whole life in the place of his birth: the south of sunny Tajikistan. He helped his parents raise animals since childhood, so he has extensive experience. He is married and is raising 9 children. He has been raising livestock for over 20 years. He has a large homestead, since raising 9 children requires a lot of resources. He is the most honest and hardworking business man at the local market. He sells his animals to butchers and others. Thanks to his tireless work he has his own loyal customers. Jura is planning to further develop his business, so he is asking for a loan in order to buy animals. He is asking for a 1100 USD loan. He appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: Buy cattle to increase his working capital

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru: Нигина трудолюбивая и умная женщина. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации и отправляет деньги. Нигина тоже сама зарабатывает, так как более 6 лет она занимается услугой портнихи. Она шьет у себя дома женские, детские национальные платья. Также она шьет занавески по заказу для домов и офисов. Она старается удовлетворить своих клиентов высококачественной пошивом одежды и занавески. Отправленные деньги мужа не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами и поэтому она должна расширить свой бизнес и получать больше дохода. Она нуждается в новой швейной машинки, а также ткани для шитья больше национальных платьев. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и ткани. Она обещает, как честный человек погасить займ во время. Нигина ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nigina is a hard working and intelligent woman. She is 29 years old, married, and has a child. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia who sends money home. Nigina also works, as she has been a dressmaker for over six years. She works out of her home, sewing traditional dresses for women and children. She also sews curtains to order for houses and offices. She tries to please her clients with high quality tailoring of the clothes and curtains she makes. The money her husband sends is not enough to provide the family with everything it needs, so Nigina needs to expand her business and earn a higher income. She needs a new sewing machine, and also fabric for making more of the traditional dresses. She is asking for a 5000 TJS loan to buy a sewing machine and fabric. She promises that as an honest person, she will repay the loan on time. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric for sewing traditional dresses

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is married and has no children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six months, he has operated a poultry selling business. He sells to his neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation to his place of operation.

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Ortikjon

texts.ru: Ортикчон трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Семья у нее дружная, поэтому все проблемы, которые возникают в семье, легко решаются. Ортикчон замужем и имеет 4 детей. Муж Ортикчона учитель и работает в средней школе села. Дети взрослые и имеют своих дел, то есть они помогают Ортикчон введение бизнеса. Самый младший сын учится в университете. Ортикчон и ее дети более 10 лет занимаются скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как кукуруз, хлопок и другие зерновые культуры. Несколько лет назад 2 ее сыновей женились и после свадьбы они остались без скота, так как они продали всех для проведения свадебного торжества. Было очень трудно жить без молока, кефира и масло. Но дружная семья справилась с трудностью с помощи кредита. В этом году они купили еще 2 га земли. Теперь они имеют 6 га земли. Ортикчон и ее дети хотят сделать посев на 6 га земли. Ортикчон запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ortikjon is a hardworking and conscientious woman. Her family is amicable so all the problems that come up in the family are easy to solve. Ortikjon is married and has four children. Her husband is a teacher at the town's middle school. Her children are grown, have their own work and help Ortikjon run the business. The youngest son teaches at the university. Ortikjon and her children have been raising animals and raising crops such as corn, barley, and other grains, for over 10 years. A few years ago two of her sons married, and after the weddings they were left without animals since they sold everything to pay for the wedding festivities. It was very hard to live without milk, kefir, and butter. But the family addressed the hardship with the help of a loan. This year they bought two more hectares of land, and now own a total of six hectares. Ortikjon and her children want to plant on all six hectares. She is asking for a 5000 TJS loan for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. She appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer for growing crops

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County This county has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 20 to 29 years old, only one of whom is in school and living at home.  For the past three years, she has been selling charcoal. She started this business with money that she landed from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. In the near future, she wants to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж бизнес мен, а сама Зулфия работает учительницей в средней школе. Она преподает младшим классам. Зулфия очень хороший педагог и знает свое дело на отлично. Зулфия дополнительно занимается услугой портнихи. Она очень упорно трудится и старается, чтобы ее клиентки были довольные. Уже несколько лет, как Зулфия и ее муж начали стройку нового дома, так как их дом очень старый и не имеет нормального условия. В этом году они хотят сделать крышу, но не имеют денег. Зулфия запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки шифера и древесина. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет Зулфие достроить дом и таким образом улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a good and hardworking woman. She is 45 years old, married, and does not have children. Her husband is a businessman, and Zulfiya herself teaches the youngest grade at a middle school. Zulfiya is a very good teacher and is skilled at her work. She is also a dressmaker. She works tirelessly and always seeks her clients' satisfaction. A few years ago Zulfiya and her husband began building a new house since their home is very old and does not meet standard conditions. This year they want to do the roof, but don't have enough money. Zulfiya is asking for a loan of 10000 TJS to buy slate and wood. She appreciates your kindness. This loan will help Zulfiya finish the house and in doing so, improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy slate and wood for making roof of new house

loans.name: Turdy

texts.ru: Турди прекрасная женщина, любимая мать 4 детей и мудрая бабушка 12 внуков. Она замужем за хорошего человека, который работает в цементном заводе. Турди более 19 лет работает в  государственной организации бухгалтером. Она профессионал своего дела. Дети Турди взрослые. Двое его сыновей находятся в России. Они работают разнорабочими. Турди хочет помочь внуку, так как ее внук имеет маленький доход и не может сыграть своего свадебного торжества. Сын Турди не отправляет нормальные деньги, чтобы они сыграли его свадьбу. Турди запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества любимого внука. Турди и ее внук ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: Turdy is a wonderful woman: the loving mother of four children and wise grandmother of 12 grandchildren. She is married to a good man who works in a cement factory. Turdy has worked as an accountant for a government agency for over 19 years. She is a professional in her field. Turdy's children are grown. Two of her sons are in Russia, where they are unskilled laborers. Turdy wants to help one of her grandchildren, who has a low income and cannot afford his wedding celebration. Turdy's son is not sending enough money to fund the wedding. Turdy is asking for a 4500 TJS loan to pay for the wedding of her beloved grandson. Turdy and her grandson appreciate your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for the wedding festivities for her beloved grandchild

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a married man who has not been blessed with children. He lives in a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Reuben has been operating a charcoal selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and villagers. His greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation. With a loan of KSHS 25,000, he wants to purchase charcoal for resale.  He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda is 29 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children who are 3 and 10 years old. They attend school and live at home. She has been selling palm oil for the past three years. She says that her main challenge is the transportation cost. She started this business with money given to her by her father and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and what make her proud is that it enables her to take care of her children. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil to enlarge her business. She plans to build a house for children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a business lady living in Malindi, Kenya. She is a widowed mother of three school-going children. She runs a mobile money transfer system, which has a great customer base in the country.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to add till money through the increased float. She believes the family will enjoy an improved health status and education from the increased income.

loans.use: To add to the money on hand needed to process money transfers

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 40 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Teopista has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes.

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Teopista hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a wholesale shop. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teopista who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is from Iraq. He is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. Abbas and one of his children provide the family income together.

Abbas works hard in his blacksmith’s shop to provide for his children’s school fees. He specializes in making doors, windows, and fences. He has good experience in what he practices. He has been in this field for over 10 years, but in 2011, he established his own business. Thanks to the good variety of his services, Abbas gained an excellent reputation and now he has a hired employee.

Abbas is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his blacksmith shop. Abbas aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children a good education and a decent life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for two years and has rentals as an additional income source. After he had three children, he realized that the rent he was collecting from tenants would not substantively support the family, so he set up a retail shop. His dreams are to educate his children and expand his business to new areas, despite the challenges of stiff competition and inflation. Pauline is requesting money to buy soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is an Iraqi youth client who is 27 years old, married and has a child. 

Malek is a farmer. He works hard to provide his family’s income and his wife takes care of their child. Since his childhood, Malek has been helping his father to milk cows and make dairy products. He gained good experience in this field. In 2008, Malek completely took over his father’s business and started to grow fast. He gained an excellent reputation in the surrounding area thanks to the quality of the products that he offers.

Malek is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to buy two new cows in order to increase his productions and his profits. Malek aims to grow his business even more so that he will be able to educate his child and take care of his parents as well.

loans.use: to buy two new cows

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 36 years old, married with two children and living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years now, he has been running an advertising firm and the business has been very lucrative. Like most businessmen, he has challenges of high rental and license fees. His dreams are to have branches in other districts. Robert intends to use the loan to buy office equipment.

loans.use: to buy office equipment

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for four years. Salome is a married mother of two school-going children. She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal and packaging bags for sale. She will pay for her children’s school fees from the extra income.
 
Despite the challenge of high cost of transportation, Salome believes the business has a future and besides getting the income to educate her children, she looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal and packaging bags to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 46 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with three children between 14 and 25 years old who attend school and live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for the past 10 years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор житель города Душанбе - столицы Таджикистана. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Абдусаттор занимается бизнесом. Он в автоцентре города арендует маслобойню и занимается там производством масел на продажу. Он в этой области уже два года. Его маслобойня предоставляет услуги 24 часа в сутки. У Абдусаттора два рабочих, которые работают там посменно. Абдусаттор берет кредит для закупа сырья для производства масла на продажу. В дальнейшем за счет прибыли Абдусаттор планирует открыть еще одну мааслобойню для производства масел и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abdusattor lives in the city of Dushanbe - Tajikistan's capital. He is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Abdusattor is an entrepreneur: he rents a small oil extraction shop in the city centre, where he produces vegetable oils for sale. He has been engaged in this for the past two years. Abdusattor's oil production operates 24 hrs a day with the help of two employees who work in shifts.

Abdusattor is taking this loan to purchase raw ingredients for oil extraction. In the future, he plans to use his profits to open another oil extraction shop, thereby expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for extraction of vegetable oil

loans.name: Eshonqul

texts.ru: Эшонкул житель района Шахритус, расположенный в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и отец двух сыновей и троих дочерей. Его сыновья уехали на заработки в Россию. Он живет с женой, тремя дочерьми, невесткой и внуками. Эшонкул уже три года занимается животноводством, а именно купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он закупает коров и телят со скотного рынка района Шахритус, откармливает их в течение 30-35 дней и затем перепродает с наценкой. Кредит берет для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Eshonqul lives in the Shahrituz region, which is located in the south-western part of the Khalton province of Tajikistan. He is 50 years old, married, and is a father of two sons and three daughters. Eshonqul's sons have left to find work in Russia, and he currently lives with his wife, three daughters, a daughter-in-law, and grandchildren.

Eshonqul has been an animal farmer for the past three years, buying and reselling cattle. He purchases cows and calves at the Shahrituz regional livestock market, fattens them for 30-35 days, and then resells them with a markup. Eshonqul is taking this loan to purchase additional cattle in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for fattening and resale

loans.name: Abduqakhor

texts.ru: Абдукахору 53 года. У него жена и трое детей. Он проживает в районе Рудаки. Его жена работает швеей, а один сын находится на заработках в загранице. У Абдукахора среднее техническое образование. Вот уже 20 лет как он работает сварщиком. Он занимается производством железных дверей и решеток. Абдукахор является мастером своего дела, так как у него большой опыт в этой области. Кредит берет для приобретения металлического материала для производства железных дверей и решеток. В будущем Абдукахор планирует открыть свой собственный цех по производству железных дверей и решеток.
texts.en:
Abduqakhor is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in the Rudaki region. Abduqakhor's wife works as a seamstress, while one of his sons is working abroad. Abduqakhor has vocational secondary education. For the past 20 years, he has been working as a welder, manufacturing iron gates and fences. Thanks to his extensive experience, Abduqakhor is a master of his craft. 

Abduqakhor is taking this loan to purchase metal stock for making gates and fences. In the future, he plans to open his own workshop for manufacturing such products.

loans.use: to purchase stock material for making iron gates and fences

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for six years. In this business, he sells retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is the high cost of products. 

Patrick is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy retail stock such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old Iraqi youth client, who is married and has a child. Ahmad is the only provider in his family.

Ahmad is a grocer. He sells canned foods, juices, soft drinks, dairy products, detergents, shampoos and tissue paper. He established his business in 2011. He has gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent of his grocery store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to educate his child and pay his school fees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store.

loans.name: Jean Nepo

texts.en: Jean Nepo is a 41-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Jean Nepo started selling lights in September 2012, and he has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Dative, and their four children.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more materials to make clothes and ready-made clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy retail stock, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling as retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. 

Kazungu dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future and with the loan of KES 25,000, he will buy seven sacks of charcoal to boost his business and meet the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy seven sacks of charcoal to boost his business

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a widowed mother of two school children. 

She owns a grocery shop, a business which has been running for five years. In the business, she sells foodstuffs, household goods etc.

She learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. 
 
Irene is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to buy grocery stocks, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. 

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy grocery stocks, e.g. maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 55 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has eight children. 

For the past 10 years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his small milling business, which has a milling machine. 

To help expand his business, Vincent has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase maize and rice millet for milling and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. 

Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a cow and start up a milk business. 

Vincent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vincent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase maize and rice millet for milling.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 40-year-old lady from Migori, married to Joe. They have no children, but support 10 people from their extended family.

She sells vegetables and dried fish. She has had this business for the past six years with an monthly income of KES 11,000. 

She is now borrowing her second loan of KES 45,000 from KADET LTD, which she wants to use to expand her business by buying more sacks of vegetables and dried fish. She will use her profits to repay the loan and add stock to her business.

Her dream is to buy a plot and build her own home.

loans.use: To buy sacks of vegetales to sell to the customers

loans.name: Mouthanna

texts.en:
Mouthanna is an Iraqi youth client, who is 29 years old, married and has a single child. 

Mouthanna owns a small grocery shop and sells canned food, juice, soft drinks, dairy products, detergents and shampoos. He used to work in this field as an employee at a grocery shop, where he gained his experience. In 2008, after gaining all the needed experience, Mouthanna established his own business and gained the respect of his neighbourhood.

Mouthanna is requesting a $2,400 youth loan to buy two new refrigerators. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he may be able to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to buy two new refrigerators

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 39-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. 

Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Paul started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Leonie and their four children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Willys

texts.en:
Willys is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is single and runs a second hand clothing business which has been in operation for the last two years. He also runs a grocery stall.
Willys was introduced to Milango by his friends and is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya Shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes such as skirts, trousers, dresses, and handbags. He looks forward to owning a boutique in the future despite the challenge of fluctuating prices.

loans.use: to buy stocks of skirts, trousers, dresses, and handbags.

loans.name: Kuturob

texts.en: Kuturob is 36 years old, and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with a six-year-old child. She is a high school graduate, and for the past 3 years she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has operated a greengrocer shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby, for a long time. He faces a major challenge of high competition from other greengrocers. He dreams of establishing a fruit parlour in the future.

With the loan that he is requesting he wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business and he is very appreciative of the last kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel operates a charcoal-selling business and his potential clients are neighbours and passers-by. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the loan of KES 50,000 he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve his business and again he appreciates the previous Kiva loan which helped him to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Alyaa

texts.en:
Alyaa is a married youth client from Iraq. She is 23 years old, married and has two children. Alyaa assists her husband in providing the income of the family.

Alyaa is a tailor and works from home. She has been practicing tailoring since 2006 and specializes in tailoring both children's and women's outfits. She has gained good experience in this field and has gained an excellent reputation.

Alyaa is requesting a youth loan of $2,100 to buy a new sewing machine and to renovate her workplace. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, so she may be able to rent a big workplace and expand her business there.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and to renovate her workplace

loans.name: Aadel

texts.en:
Aadel is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. Aadel works hard to provide for his family all by himself.
Aadel owns a small shop and specializes in selling and repairing watches. He has been in this field for over 15 years and established his own business in 2000. He has gained much experience in what he practices and is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation since he has worked in the market for an extended period of time.
Aadel is requesting a sum of 2,400 USD to pay the annual rent for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may educate his children and afford to cover their school fees.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his watch shop.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child, who is a grown-up and does not completely depend on her. She runs a clothes shop which has been operating for four years.   

Esha was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenya Shillings to purchase a new stock of clothes for sale e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers, shirts etc.

Esha believes the income from this loan will help her meet her needs. She is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of bad debts and the high cost of stock from the suppliers which makes most of her items beyond reach of the public.

loans.use: To buy a new stock of clothes e.g. handbags, shoes, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old and lives Montserrado County which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with a three-year-old child which lives at home. 

She has been selling oil, rice, coal, onions etc. for the past two years. She started this business with help from her boyfriend and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part of her business is the profit that she makes every day, and the fact that she has lots of customers. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more oil, rice, coal, onions etc for her business. She appreciates the supporters of BRAC Liberia, and she promises to pay back her loan on time. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, coal and onions for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sets of spanners, screws and other spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Al-Forat Group

texts.en: Al-Forat is a group of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 240,000 YER. Ebtsam is a 32-year-old, illiterate married woman with six children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented house. They bought a small piece of land to build their own house. She needs money to pay for construction supplies, so she applied for a loan in the amount of 60,000 YER. She hopes, after completing the building of her house, to start thinking of a small business to help in improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for her house

loans.name: Amina Group

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old, a hardworking woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and one son. Her husband is working in a garment shop. Her son is eight years old and he wants to be a doctor. Amina is working hard to fulfill the dreams of her son. She has been helping her husband by stitching clothes in her house from 2003, as her husband’s income is too low to meet the educational expenses of their son. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly and her clients always appreciate her work.

As a member of a two-person lending group, Amina has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she wants to purchase a new sewing machine as her old machine is not working properly and it’s very difficult for her to continue the business. She can increase her production by stitching more dresses in less time and she can work efficiently with a new sewing machine. 

With the profit amount she wants to pay the educational expenses of her son. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

NOTE:In the picture Amina is raising her hand

loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine to stitch more dresses

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, who appears in the picture, is an 18-year-old single woman who lives in Haja, Yemen. She  has completed secondary school. 

She is requesting a youth loan of 70,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to help cover the cost of purchasing a computer. This will help her to enhance her computer skills, and to do her reports at home. This will ensure a better future for her and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy computer for personal use.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 28 years old and lives in Montserrado County. This county has the largest Free-Port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with an eight-year-old child who attends school.

She has been selling charcoal, oil, rice etc for the past two years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, rice etc for her business. In the near future she wants to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 37 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with 5 children between 10 and 21 years old, which are attending school and live at home. She has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, vita, etc. for the past 7 years. She says her main challenge is the transportation cost. She started this business with money given to her by her mother and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is it gives her money. What make her proud is that it enables her to take care of children and herself. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales. She plans to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, salt, and vita to expand her sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house consumables.
For over three years, she has operated a vegetable stall, selling from her home to her neighbors and others that pass by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality when selling vegetables. Elizabeth dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. 
She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province. He is married and has eight children. He owns a timber shop which he has been operating it for two years now. He started the business with his little savings.
He learnt about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is high cost of transport and scarcity of stock.
Joseph is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to buy timber, nails and other supplies for the workshop. His extra income from the loan will be used to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other supplies for his wood workshop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and together with her husband they have two children. This couple always strives to give their children a good education and to insure that their needs are met.
Margaret has been working for the last 7 years braking up and selling charcoal. She buys the product in various cities in the interior of the country and sells it broken up in various sized bags.
She requests this loan to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that she can acquire it at a better price and earn higher profits to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that she can buy it at a better price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase timber, a planing machine and varnish etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is from Kisauni. She is married and together they have two small children, who are the couple's reason to struggle for success.

Gladys has a business selling fruit and vegetables at the town market. She occupies two stands. She has a fixed customer base, good income and good business and personal references. She is a hard-working woman and an excellent client.

She is asking for this loan to purchase fruit and vegetables to stock her store with products and to be able to continue giving her customers the quality they expect from her.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Eppian

texts.en:
Eppian is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married businessman who runs a clothes shop, which has been operating for ten years.

He started the shop through the savings from a casual job in a barber shop. In the current shop, he sells men's clothing, dresses and shoes etc.

He was introduced to Milango by his friends and joined to access credit. He is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to purchase new clothing for sale. 

Eppian believes the income from this loan will help him educate his children and is focused on owning a wholesale shop despite the challenge of bad debts.

loans.use: To purchase new stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Today Peter is happy working in his own salon with a fixed customer base.
He is requesting a loan to buy furniture, such as a chair, mirror and other items, for his shop, which will help him continue to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy furniture, such as a chair, mirror and other items, for his barber shop.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman, who has 8 kids that attend school. Her husband is a farmer and together they own a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.
Mwaka has operated a kiosk for the past 6 years. Her clients are ladies and gents in the area. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.
With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar. 
She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and sugar for her kiosk.

loans.name: Rajwa

texts.en:
For the past years, Rajwah has had a sewing workshop, sewing clothes for customers, which has been a profitable project.

Rajwah is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing an additional sewing machine and textiles to provide better quality to her loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Rajwah's income.

The business has been a profitable project, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Rajwah appears in her sewing workshop.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sewing machine and textiles

loans.name: Syeeda

texts.en:
Syeeda is 32 years old. She is a responsible and diligent mother of three children. Her husband died last year and one of her sons is currently studying in school. Her elder son is working as an auto mechanic in a workshop and this is the only source of income for her family. He is working hard to educate his younger brother and to meet the household expenses.

Syeeda has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. Her son wants to open his own workshop. He is a skilled auto mechanic and their monthly income and savings would be increased if he has his own workshop. With the loan amount, he would also purchase some new tools and equipment for vehicle repairing and tuning. 

Syeeda is very hopeful for this loan and she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC for helping her.

loans.use: to open a new workshop and purchase repairing tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals etc.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a very hard-working person, who explains that thanks to his effort he has been able to get ahead. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to him and he is very grateful for it. 

Today, he is requesting another loan, to be able to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed with which he will be able to continue offering a wide variety and good prices to his clients. 

He is again grateful for the opportunity he is receiving because it will help him a lot.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Tseko

texts.en:
He is a very hard-working person who, thanks to his efforts, is getting ahead and helping his family day by day. He tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that he makes an effort to move forward.

He is asking for this loan in order to purchase clothing of all types to supply his business. In this way, he will be able to continue working and having sales that will give him the income to maintain his home.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a stock of groceries such as maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a married business man and runs a service shop mainly offering electrical repairs for motor vehicles.

Paul learnt about Milango through advertisements and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and bad debts, and the presence of fake products in the market.

Paul is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya Shillings to buy spare parts and kits. He believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments and to be able to open another business to be run by his wife.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and kits.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a single mother of three children; all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother, niece, and nephew). She has a business of making envelopes for photographs and drugs. She has been in this business for 13 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activities. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more paper and glue. She works from her home seven days-a-week and sells on both a wholesale and retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to acquire a shop where she can sell her products and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more paper and glue.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet is a villager from Kampong Cham province, age 32 and married. For Yet, rice and cassava cultivation is the main source of family income. This is the business that she has been with for 14 years.

Yet is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In need of working capital, she is seeking a loan in order to buy an additional plot of farmland. She will use it for growing more cash crops. She hopes to gain a high yield, with more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy an additional plot of farmland for growing more cash crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is from Balug province of Isabela. She is 53, married, and has two children. For 15 years, she has owned and operated a specialized home products sales where she earns PHP 5,000 a month. 

Josefina is now requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000, which will be used to purchase new items, such as detergent soap, bar soap, shampoo, and liquid soap, for her business . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent soap, bar soap, shampoo, and liquid soap, for her business.

loans.name: Cristo Es La Esperanza 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Margarita is the coordinator of Cristo es la Esperanza (Christ is the hope) 4, 5 & 6. She lives with her long-term partner and their three children in a simple structure, located in a rural community in the city of La Romana. Specifically, the community is a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers.

Margarita says that her most important challenge is to have her own house and to raise her children providing their own safe home and all their needs. She operates a fruits and vegetables stall, a place where she sells goods to make daily income for food. This is a small stall in front of her house selling the most favored vegetables like plantains, cassava, potatoes, and veggies for salad. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy vegetables, fruits, meats, charcoal, etc. 

Margarita is excited to receive her second loan with Esperanza, each one helping her to improve her business. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save. Margarita thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Raksmey is 33 years old and blessed with two little boys. For her family, rice-cropping and bean-growing are the main sources of income; this is the business that she has been with for 11 years. 

Raksmey is a third-time client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan with success, and it has helped her to upgrade her lifestyle in good shape. Since she wants to expand her cash-crop growing business, she is seeking a loan to buy a plot of farmland for the upcoming replanting reason for this cycle. 

She hopes that she can grow her crops timely and fruitfully, so that she can earn more income to stabilize her living, and also buy more cows for raising.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for the upcoming replanting reason for this cycle.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
"Naite is a 70-year-old, married woman, who has four children. She has a small plantation, and she grows taro, taamu, bananas and yams, to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.
Naite has requested a loan, which she will use to purchase farming tools and supplies, including fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Naite hopes to improve her plantation and support her family, as well as her grand children's education."

loans.use: to purchase farming tools and supplies, including fertilizers, chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes and rakes.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en: Benito, a 60-year-old fisherman and seaweed farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol, is a married father of 13. Benito is requesting a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, etc., purchases that will enable him to improve his seaweed farming business and augment his income. Moreover, he wants to save money to reinvest in the same business and to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. Ofelia is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ofelia is requesting a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soap, noodles, bread, spices, canned goods, etc., to sell in her store.

Ofelia has been in this business for 21 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting for an additional loan build her general store and pig fattening business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soap, noodles, bread, spices, canned goods, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Chito

texts.en:
Chito is 35 years old and married with 5 children. He lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates an agriculture business which is selling crabs in the local community to earn a living. He has been in his business for over 5 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month.

He joined GDMPC in the year 2011 and now he has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional crabs to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 30 years old and single. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, he owns and operates a transportation service in the local community. He has been in his business for over three years and earns PHP 8,000 every month. 

He joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012 and now he has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase spare parts and  new tires. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and new tires.

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.en:
Inocencio earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. 

He is a married man and a father of three children from Ubay, Bohol. 

Inocencio is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Jess

texts.en:
Jess is a 29-year-old married man and a father of three children from CPG, Bohol. 

He is engaged in a motorcycle transport business. He is also in a rice farming venture.
