Jess is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and fuel for the motorcycle. With this, he will be able to improve his businesses and income. In the future, Jess hopes to make his businesses successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm and fuel for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 40-year-old, married man from Ubay, Bohol. He is a father of two children. The youngest is 10, while the oldest is 11 years old. Roberto is providing motorcycle services to the people in his community.  He transports passengers from one place to remote places.

He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tires, fuel, and spare parts for the motorcycle. These purchases will enable him to continue to serve his customers and to avoid hassle and delays while transporting customers. In the future, Roberto would like to invest in other business ventures, to support his family as well as the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tires, fuel, and spare parts for the motorcycle

loans.name: Japeth

texts.en: Japeth is 20 years old and single. He lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a transportation service business to earn a living. He has been in his business  for over two years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and tires.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is a 46-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation that grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Makerita has requested a loan to buy more equipment to expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Makerita hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy a grass cutter, bush knives and fertilizer

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en: Rogelio is a 36-year-old married man from Carlos P.Garcia, Bohol. He is engaged in fishing; he catches fish, sea shells, and shrimp. He has been in this fishing business for 8 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy fish nets, nylons, and fish floaters to increase his volume of catch, as well as increase his sales. In the future, Rogelio would like to expand his business to improve his status of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, nylons, and fish floaters for his fishing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase calling cards.

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marcelina is the coordinator of the group La Buena Nueva (Good New) 1, 2 & 3, located in the city of Samana, in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the members are selling goods like clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls and other businesses. 

Marcelina is a married woman and a mother of eight children, five of whom live together with her and their father. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to built her house, which she started and still needs to finish. She is saving her business profits to produce capital and start investing it to grow her business. 

She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics, and this loan, her 11th, will be used to buy these products to expand her inventory. She is hoping to make her dreams come true, have a prosperous life and a good business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Muhamadjon

texts.ru: Мухамадчону 38 лет. Он с женой и четырьмя детьми проживает в районе Кубадиён в юго-западной части Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Жена Мухамадчон занимается сельским хозяйством, а дети учатся в школе. Сам Мухамадчон занимается растениеводством более 10 лет. Он в основном выращивает пшеницу и бахчевые культуры. Мухамадчон запрашивает кредит для закупа семян арбуза, минеральных удобрений и за оплату тракториста. Летом он надеется получить хорошую прибыль с урожая арбуза.
texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Muhmadjon lives together with his wife and four children in the southwestern part of Tajikistan's Khatlon province. His wife works in farming and his children go to school. Muhmadjon has been working in horticulture for more than ten years. He mainly grows wheat and melons. 

Muhmadjon is requesting a loan to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer as well as to pay a tractor driver. In the summer he hopes to make a good profit off of his watermelon crop.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers and to pay a tractor driver

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Janira is the coordinator of the group La Buena Nueva (Good New) 3 & 5, located in the city of Samana, in one of the rural areas surrounded by the waters of the Atlantic ocean. Many of the members are selling goods like bread, clothing, shoes or cosmetics. Others sell seafood, run fried food stalls and other businesses.

Janira lives together with her long-term partner and her child. She is running a bakery where she sells bread. She started her business around seven years ago. She has been investing every loan to increase her sales and to buy different gadgets. This is her 12th loan. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to establish her business, but she has made it possible to sell bread to her community and others nearby. She will use this loan to buy ingredients for the bakery like flour, yeast, butter, salt and other products.

Janira is hoping to make her dreams come true: to have a successful business and provide for her family's needs. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, butter, salt and other products.

loans.name: Gavharoi

texts.ru: Гавхарой - женщина пастух. Она отлично умеет разводить крупно рогатый скот и мелко рогатый скот. Так как в семье не было сыновей, Гавхарой с детство помогала отцу в скотоводстве. Теперь приобретённые навыки и занятия отца стали источником дохода Гавхарой. Также она занимается дехканским хозяйством, от которого получает овощи, зелень и фрукты для ежедневного питания семьи. Вот уже тридцать лет она приносит "хлеб" в семью занятием скотоводство. В связи с временными трудностями связанное с финансами, Гавхарой решила обратиться за кредитом и доверила МДО "Арванд" свой будущий доход и благополучие. На приобретенный кредит хочет купить корм и крупный рогатый скот.  Заранее благодарит МДО "Арванд" за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Gavharoi is a female shepherd. She is great at raising cattle, sheep, and goats. As there was no son in her family, Gavharoi helped her father raise livestock as a child. Now the skills that she gained and her father's lessons have become Gavharoi's main source of income. Additionally, she works on a dehkan farm, where she gets her family's daily vegetables, greens, and fruit. Hence, her animal husbandry work has been bringing in her family's "daily bread" for 30 years. Due to time constraints associated with her finances, Gavharoi decided to turn to a loan. She has entrusted her future income and material well-being to MDO "Arvand". She wants to purchase cattle and cattle feed with the loan. She thanks MDO "Arvand" in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло  очень скромная, трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры. Детства Шахло прошла очень тяжело, то есть отец не имел постоянной место работы. Муж Шахло уехал на заработки в Россию, а сама работает уборщицей в школе. Уже более 5 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается животноводством. В целях повышения своей навыки Шахло, приняла участие на курсе «Добейся успеха» проведённого Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и «Имон Интернешнл». Она изучила много интересного, научилась составить бизнес планы, но у нее проблемы с деньгами. В семье в данный момент финансовые проблемы. Шахло планирует, чтобы её дочь поступила в университет, но на учёбу у нее не хватает денег.  Она должна зарабатывать деньги на учёбу дочери и  содержание семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы расширить свой новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahlo is a humble, hard-working, and determined woman. She was born in a rural area and has significant experience in animal husbandry and crop farming. She had a difficult childhood because her father never had permanent work. 

Shahlo's husband went to Russia to find work and she works as a cleaning lady in a school. Additionally, she started working in animal husbandry five months ago. 

With the goal of improving her skill set, Shahlo took the course "Bring It On", led by the Business Women's Association and IMON International. She learned many interesting things including how to make her own business plan. However, her family currently has financial problems. 

Shahlo is planning for her daughter to go to university, but she doesn't have enough money. She has to earn the money for her daughter's education and still support her family. She is requesting a 5000 som loan for purchasing cattle to start her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира трудолюбивая женщина, которая живет среди гор северного Таджикистана. Она выросла в сельской местности и с детства очень упорно трудилась. Ей не удалось получить высшее образование и таким образом, она осталась без высшего образования и без какой- либо ремесла. После замужества ей очень было трудно жить, так как пошли дети, а ее муж получал маленькую зарплату. Были и такие дни, что ей и ее детям нечего было есть. Она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она имеет знания о бизнесе. Она планирует организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки скота. Она очень нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nazira is a hard-working woman, who lives in the northern Tajikistan mountains. She grew up in a rural area and has worked tirelessly since childhood. She wasn't able to get a university education. Hence, she was left without a trade. 

After marrying, Nazira's life became very difficult. She had children and her husband had a very small salary. Some days there was nothing for her and her children to eat. 

Then, she found out about a course called "Bring It On", organized by the Business Women's Association. She got a certificate from the course and now has the skills to work in business. She is planning to start her own animal trade business. She is requesting a loan of 1500 American dollars to purchase cattle. She sincerely needs your help and is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.ru: Гулноза очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина. Она родилась в сельской местности, и имеет достаточный опыт по животноводству. Детства Гулнозы было очень тяжело, то есть отец уехал на заработки в Россию, а мама работала уборщицей в школе. После окончания средней школы она поступила в институт в заочное отделение. В свободное время от занятий она занимается шитьём, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи и помогать родителям. Уже более 2 месяцев она самостоятельно занимается этим бизнесом. Мать помогает ей в ведении бизнеса.  В целях повышения своей навыки Гулноза, приняла участие на тренинге «Добейся успеха» проведённого Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и «Имон Интернешнл». Она изучила много интересного, научилась составить бизнес планы, но у нее проблемы с деньгами. Она должна сама зарабатывать деньги на учёбу в институте и на своё содержание. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы развевать свой новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulnoza is a very hardworking and determined woman. She was born in a rural area and has significant experience in animal husbandry. Her childhood was difficult because her father left to find work in Russia and her mother worked as a cleaning lady in a school. 

After completing high school, Gulnoza was accepted to the correspondence program at the institute. In her free time, she sews to make money for her family. She has been working like this for two months now. Her mother helps her with running this business. 

In order to improve her skill set, Gulnoza participated in the training "Bring It On", organized by the Business Women's Association and IMON International. She learned many interesting things including how to make her own business plan. 

Unfortunately, Gulnoza has money problems. She needs to earn money to pay for her school and to support herself. She is requesting a 3000 som loan to purchase a sewing machine so that she can develop her new business. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for developing her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction tools and office supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To provide books to at-risk youth.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: A citizen from Kampong Cham province’s Thbaung Khmum district, Pov, is 41 years old and blessed with five children. Out of her five children, only two kids still rely on her as they are still in school. Her 23 years of experience in rice farming and cassava growing has returned her about 16,400 KHR per day, and she saves about 4,400 KHR per day after deducting other expenses. She has never been with VisionFund before, and she is now forming a group of three to apply for a new loan.  All of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, Pov will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to grow her cash-crop on time and double her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for labor costs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sothy's Group

texts.en: Sothy is 33 years old and married.  In her family, there are five members including her three children who are still in school. The rest of her family is living in Sampov Meas district of Pursat province. To deal with the daily cost of living, she grows cassava and sells grocery items as the main source of income. Her 10 years of experience in the current business has returned her about 41,600 KHR per day. This cycle, she is a fifth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans, which have supported her business with good growth. Now, she is in a group of five to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to plow her cassava crop and to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her business at a good pace and sustain her living.

loans.use: To plow her cassava crop and to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert’s parents, Rob and Betty, were getting tired and older and couldn't agree: Do we expand or drop the 7-year-old catering business, R&B Kitchens? Weary of working as a cook at other restaurants, Robert seized the opportunity and took charge of the family business.
  
In addition to his mother’s teaching, Robert had honed his skills by attending culinary school. As a former chef for different restaurants, Robert said he wanted to be in charge and create food his way, but he always deferred to the head chefs, so he didn’t have the freedom he sought. So, his taking over the family business was a win for both his parents and Robert.
 
Now in charge of the El Paso business, R&B Kitchens, Robert says his plan is to expand the catering business by adding soul food to the Cajun menu, as well as adding a restaurant. His mother, whom he credits as the foundation for the family’s cooking talents, will cook alongside his father and sister at the restaurant.
 
While out shopping for restaurant equipment, Robert ran into an Accion Texas Inc. loan officer, who invited him to her office. After getting approved, Robert used his loan to buy supplies, as well as tables, chairs and shelves to remodel an older restaurant. Robert says with the loan, he was able to replace old wall tiles and repair mirrors.
 
Had he not received his Accion loan, Robert said he and his family would have had to have waited at least another month to open, since all they had to invest in the new restaurant was $500.
 
Within the next four months, Robert plans to hire more employees and establish a website.

loans.use: To renovate a restaurant.

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Originally from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Bopha is 54 years old and a married mother with eight children. 

To earn a living, she and her husband grow corn on two hectares of land. They have been doing this for 30 years. Her husband uses his spare time to earn extra income by driving a taxi.

Bopha is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a loan to buy a decent car for husband to drive to earn extra income in his taxi business. She hopes to earn a high yield and relieve her family’s burden.

loans.use: To buy a car for her husband's taxi service.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en: A father of four children living in Kampong Cham province, Khom, is 47 years old and a farmer. He works in rice farming and cassava growing on two and three hectare areas, respectively, with the support from his wife. He has been involved in the current business for 27 years. Khom is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has used his past loan to sustain his business with a good output. Now, he is seeking a new loan to buy fertilizer and to pay the labor fees for his farmland. He hopes to gain a high income for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay the labor fees for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Anita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of meat and other ingredients for her food-vending business.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married and has four children; her husband is dead. 

She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better after she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies for her store such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes and second-hand bags.

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, shoes and bags.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, a 42-year-old married mother of six, works hard to provide for her family. For the past two years she has run a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Having borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF, Leonila is requesting a new one for PHP 15000 to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. She aspires to save money to expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $800. Leonia is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Daylil

texts.en:
Daylil is from Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she sells fish while her husband does the fishing. She has been in her business for five years and earns about PHP 5,000 a month from this activity. She joined GDMPC last year. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000, which will be used to repair her husband's fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her husband's fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 62 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 37 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to pay laborers' salaries and buy additional equipment for her farm. Maria is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries and buy additional equipment for her farm.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a hardworking entreprenuer who cooks and sells food for meals and snacks to the people in her village. She also manages a store. She is 53 years old, married and had three children. Her income of about P10,000 each month is used for meals, bills at home and as revolving capital in the business. She would like to increase her sales and continue cooking delicious meals. That is why she is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy meat, vegetables and soft drinks to sell.

Alejandra hopes to keep improving sales and income for the overall welfare of her family. She is very happy selling delicious foods, good products and services to all her customers. Her photo was taken in her food stall with her grandchild.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rozelia Soares

texts.en: Rozelia is taking a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is married, and she has 5 children and a husband who works as a driver. She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a bigger business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 32 years old and married. She lives in Oroqueta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agriculture business where she plants and harvests mangos for sale to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 8 years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC this year, and she has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old, married, with two children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Arlene is borrowing PHP 13,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy vaccines, vitamins and additional livestock to sell.

Arlene has been raising livestock for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, vitamins and additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old, married with two children. She lives in Oroqueta City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food-vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over eight years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell such as viands, rice, softdrinks and snacks. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her business and living situation.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as viands, rice, softdrinks and snacks.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 46-year-old from Mabini, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest is 26 and the youngest is three years old. She is engaged in a food-vending business. She has been in this business for 15 years now. This is the source of her income. She earns 4000 PHP a month. Her husband is a farmer.

Marieta is requesting a loan to buy cellophane wrappers and sugar and also to pay to process her working child's documents. With the help of this loan, she can buy what she needs for her business and in addition there will be no more problems for the processing of the documents of her child.

In the future, Marieta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cellophane wrappers and sugar and pay to process some documents.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bebina works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Bebina is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Bebina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 30-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has an 11-year-old son. She is engaged in the farming business. She also has a second business, which is fishing, to supplement the other needs of the family. She has been in this business for 12 years now together with her husband. This is the source of her income.

Marilyn is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and a fish net. This will be used in her two businesses. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for the businesses.

In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and a fish net

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 57-year-old married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merlita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Merlita has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Merlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailioring business

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
She is running a business in her house by selling sandals, cigarettes, biscuits and instant noodles. She opened her kiosk 2008 with working capital of $400.

She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she sells every day. 

Carla is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is making a good income and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan.

loans.use: To buy sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, instant noodles and other items.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 50 years old and widowed with three children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past eight years, she has owned and operated a farm where she plants and harvests vegetables to sell and earn a living. Anecita earns 5,000 PHP each month and she joined GDMPC in 2010.

Anecita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes and dreams of improving her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 25 years old and married with a child. For the past three years, she has earned a living fattening pigs in the Philippines. Charlyn also earns additional income from buying and selling piglets.

Charlyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly to attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Santina

texts.en:
Santina is living in a town with her family. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $100. 

Santina is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. A $1,000 loan is offered to Santina to improve her business.  

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like oil, detergent, soap, sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, vinegar, pens and sugar.

loans.use: To buy sandals, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, vinegar, pens, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sakhuon

texts.en:
Sakhuon, a mother of five children, is 52 years old and married. She is a local villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. 

To support her living, she farms on a one-hectare area. To earn extra income, her husband also works for others for a fee and makes chicken coops for sale. She has engaged in the current business for 20 years. 

She is a sixth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her past loans with success to support her living in a good manner and has fully repaid them. Now, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy rice seed and to pay for plowing and labor fees. She hopes that she can gain a high yield and make more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and to pay for plowing and labor fees.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 31-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest is 8 years old and the youngest is 5 years old. She is engaged in a farming business. She grows rice. She has been in this business for 2 years now. This is the source of her income. She earns about 3,000 PHP in a month.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and a tarp. A tarp is used to dry the newly harvested rice. Through this loan, she will be able to buy what she  needs for the benefit of her business. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a tarp.

loans.name: Janeta

texts.en: Janeta is 32 years old and married with 5 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 6 years and earns about 5,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase materials for a fishing boat. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a fishing boat.

loans.name: Sonia Camerao

texts.en: Sonia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as sleepers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a fish vending business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 3 years and earns about 5,000PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000PHP to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets and hooks.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel works hard to support her family. She is 38 years old and has seven children, five of whom are going to school. Maribel has a beauty parlor business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products for her business.

She has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Maribel would like to expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for her business.

loans.name: Richie

texts.en:
Richie is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a banana production business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 4 years and earns about 3,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зафар житель района Кубадиян, расположенный в юго-западной части Таджикистана. У него жена и двое маленьких детей. Ему 30 лет. Зафар вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. Он в этой области уже 5 лет. У него есть 1 га орошаемой земли, на которой он выращивает бахчевые культуры. Зафар запрашивает кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, семян арбуза и за оплату тракториста. Он хочет получить хороший уржай арбуза для продажи.
texts.en: Zafar lives in the south-western part of Tajikistan in the Qubadiyon region. He is 30 years old, married, and has 2 young children. He and his wife grow crops. He has been working in this area for 5 years now. He has 1 hectare of irrigated land where he grows melons. Zafar is seeking a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and watermelon seeds, and to pay for the services of a tractor driver. He wants to get a good harvest of watermelons to sell.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer and watermelon seeds, and to pay for the services of a tractor driver

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 49 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. For the past four years, Nena has been running a general store in the Philippines.

Nena is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, canned goods, soap, noodles, and other products. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, canned goods, soap, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns an income from running a general store. Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. 

Corazon is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years and also earns an income as a vegetable farmer. Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Rosie is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is married and lives in Ubay, Bohol. She raises hogs, which she has been doing for three years. Her husband is a baker.

Rosenda is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy feeds and vitamins so that her hogs grow healthy and free from sickness.  In the future, Rosenda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Russel

texts.en:
Russel is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She grows bananas in the local community, which she has been doing for more than five years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

Russel is requesting a loan from GDMPC, which she joined in 2011, for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her  dream is to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana productions

loans.name: Rosalia Da C. Fatima

texts.en:
Rosalia is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as fish in cans, oil, sugar, biscuits and other products. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: to buy fish in cans, oil, sugar, biscuits and other products.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 39 years old, married with one child. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, raising bananas to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 5,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase chemicals for banana production. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation and her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for banana production.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Demetria works hard to support her family.

She has a boneless dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Demetria is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to make dried fish for her boneless dried fish vending business.

Demetria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Rithy's Group

texts.en:
Rithy, 34, is married and lives with her husband and one son in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband are rice farmers. She has been in the rice farming business for 10 years, earning about 40,000 KHR per day to feed her family.  

Rithy has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her family relieve their financial burdens and improve their livelihood. 

Now she is requesting another loan with VisionFund. Rithy, who is the leader of this group, will use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Исроил великодушный человек. Ему 44 года. Он женат на прекрасной женщине, которую зовут Хосият и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Исроил вместе с семьей живет в отдаленном районе, где основным источником дохода является скотоводство и выращивание сельхоз культуры. Исроил вместе с братьями Исмоил и Элёр более 20 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры и скотоводством. Он выращивает зерновые культуры как пшеница, кукуруз и т.п. Его жена и двое из сыновей помогают ему введение бизнеса. Они продают свой богатый урожай местным жителям, а также привозят на центральный рынок района для продажи. Исроил в течение многих лет имеет проблему с водой и поэтому он решил обустроить скважину. Если он сделает скважину, то все его проблемы будут решаться легко. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки трубы для водоснабжения и тем самым обустроить скважину. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Isroil is a generous man. He is 44 years old. He is married to a wonderful woman named Khosiyat, and they have 4 children. Isroil and his family live in a remote area where the main source of income is animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops. For the last 20 years, he and his brothers Ismoil and Elior have been earning their living by raising cattle and growing crops. Isroil grows wheat, corn, and so on. His wife and two of his sons help him with his work. They sell their rich harvest to local citizens and also take it to the central market of the region to be sold. For many years, he has had problems with water supply, and for this reason, he has decided to build a well. Once he builds it, all his problems will be easily solved. Isroil is seeking a loan of 15,000 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase pipe to start construction on a well. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy pipe to build a well

loans.name: Somaly's Group

texts.en:
Somaly, 20, lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is married with one daughter. The main family’s sources of income are from growing rice and planting pineapples in the local village. The current business earns her about KHR 23,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Somaly has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve family burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Somaly wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to make more incomes so as to fulfil her dream to expand her paddy business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Salimboy

texts.ru: Салимбой трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он всегда старается обеспечить своих детей и жену хорошим условием. Салимбой имеет большой опыт по скотоводству, так как он с детства помогал отцу по данному виду бизнеса. Данное время его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Салимбой в этом году не смог получить нормальный доход и поэтому он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он там имеет несколько друзей, которые обещали его обеспечить работой. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Salimboy is a hardworking person. He is married and is raising three children. He has always tried to provide his wife and kids with a good standard of living. Salimboy has a lot of experiencing raising livestock; he helped his father raise animals from when he was a young boy. Right now his wife is helping him run the business. This year Salimboy was unable to earn his usual income, and therefore he wants to go to Russia, where he has several friends there who have promised to provide him with a job. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somonis for an air ticket. He awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket to go Russia to find a job

loans.name: Experia

texts.en:
Experia is 62 years old and widowed with eight children.

She earns a living by operating a hog-raising business in the Philippines. Experia is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Experia has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is 31 years old and married. She earns a living by running a mini-grocery in her village where she sells soft drinks, sugar, oil, coffee and vinegar. She is very committed to her business because it has been a great help in improving her family's living conditions and, most especially, saving for her future children. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy frozen foods, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, rice and bread to sell to her customers. She hopes to use this loan to increase her profits and provide a good living for her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking oil, rice and bread.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used for the repair and maintenance of her boarding house. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to pay for repair and maintenance of her boarding house. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams of being successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintainance of her boarding house.

loans.name: Botom's Group

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Botom is a 34-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. The main sources of the family’s income are from farming rice and working for others for a fee, which she has been doing for eighteen years. With her current business, she can earn about KHR 26,000 per day to spend on daily expenses. 

This is the fifth loan for Botom with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her to better support her family and give them enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, Botom will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 58 years old, married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and piglets.

Edna has been in this business for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling of piglets.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs and piglets.

loans.name: Kab's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched-roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Kab is aged 46 years old and married. She and her husband have two children. Kab and her husband earn a living through farming rice on three hectares of farmland and they have been in this business for ten years. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 25,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the sixth loan for Kab while the other member is taking her third loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to have a bigger crop yield and sell it for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
At the age of 22, Melanie started her business, a sari-sari store. She sells various grocery items in their village like soap, shampoo, toothpaste and biscuits. Now, Melanie is 27 years old. She is married, has two kids and is still managing the business. She has already been five years in this type of business.

Melanie wishes to have good health and further develop the business. She wants to extend the products she sells to her customers. Melanie is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy spices, drinks and breads to sell. She hopes to increase her sales and income as well to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy spices, drinks and breads to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more toys for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a freezer to store his fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a tool kit, and various electrical and electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Chanleap

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Takeo province’s Bati district, Cheanleap is a 28-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are dependent on her and still too young for school. She has been growing rice and coconuts in the village to make a living. She can earn about US$3 per day from the current business and can manage to save about US$1 each day after offsetting daily expenses. 

Chanleap has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is asking for another loan to buy buffaloes to help her in her farming business. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living and hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy buffaloes to help her in her farming business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old, married with two children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, candies, snack foods, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an additional income from buying and selling livestock.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, candies, snack foods, sugar, coffee and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and has one child who is in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jocelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina runs a business in front of her house selling brake oil, engine oil, battery acid, etc. Santina earns a good income from selling these items.  Santina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy more stock to sell. Santina lives in a town on the main road, so many people come to buy her products. She is open every day. She has operated her business since 2001. She started it with her own working capital.

loans.use: to buy brake oil, engine oil and battery acid.

loans.name: Lak's Group

texts.en:
Lak is 34 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the district of Moung Russey and the province of Battambang. She has four children, two of whom are in school. To earn a living, Lak has been growing pineapples. She supplements this income by selling grocery items. Her current business earns her about 11,000 KHR per day but she manages to save about 6,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses. 

Lak has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She fully paid back the previous loan, which helped her relieve her family's burden. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay to have the field plowed for planting pineapples. She hopes to get a high yield from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay to have the field plowed for planting pineapples.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Shiela works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Shiela is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, salt, cream, etc. for her bakery business.

Shiela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, salt, cream, etc. for her bakery business.

loans.name: Hideliza

texts.en:
Hideliza works hard to support her family. Hideliza is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods and tools in the Philippines.

Hideliza requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase additional stock to sell.

Hideliza has been in this business for one year now.

Hideliza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Sour

texts.en:
Aged 35 years old, Sour is a rural villager from the Kandal Stoeng district earning a living through working at garment factory while her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to better support the family. Engaged in this business for 15 years, Sour is able to earn about US$11 per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sour has been with VisionFund for five cycles and she completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for another loan with VisionFund to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work. She hopes this will enable her to reduce transportation fees.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes for sale and also pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil and cereals.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip lives in Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has four children; three of whom are in school. He owns a carpentry work shop which he has been operating it for three years now. He also earns some income from being employed as an insurance agent.

He learnt about Milango through friends and joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is limited capital to purchase stock.

Philip is applying for a loan of 36,700 Kenya Shillings to buy timber to sell. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Totesoda

texts.en:
Totesoda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business leasing farm equipment in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment for her business.

Totesoda has been in this business for 32 years. Totesoda earns additional income from farming rice.

Totesoda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her farm equipment.

loans.name: Naderson

texts.en:
Naderson lives in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. He is a water vendor, a business he started out due to the high demand of water in the populated area. Besides this, he is also a farmer.

Naderson was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenya Shillings to carry out repairs on his piping. The major challenge in the businesses are harsh climatic conditions especially affecting the farming. He looks forward to owning other water distribution outlets in future.

loans.use: To carry out repairs on his piping.

loans.name: Loern's Group

texts.en:
Loern is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Cambodia. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who earn to a living through farming rice, which they have been doing for 10 years. She earns about 12,000 KHR a day. 

Loern is requesting a loan from VisionFund for 300,000 KHR for each group member.   As the leader, she is will use her portion to buy a cart for supporting her paddy business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to purchase a cart for supporting her paddy business.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Sin is 29 years old and lives in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district in Cambodia. She has two children, both of whom are dependent on her and still in school. 

To support her family, Sin and her husband farm rice and catch fish. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 21,000 KHR per day but she manages to save about 9,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sin has been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has completely paid back the past loans, which helped relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sin will use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income. In this way, she will be able to earn a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of 1,000.00 USD. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sugar, candles, cigarettes, ketchup, coca-cola, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years of age, married and has one child. She manages a furniture making business in their village. Her husband is her partner in growing the business. They started the business with minimal capital; they are doing their best to grow the business.

Having a better way of living is the greatest dream of Marites. She has to strive and extend the products they offer to their customers to gain income. Marites is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy wood and burnish for her business. They will make new designs of chairs, dining tables and cabinets.

loans.use: to buy wood and burnish for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old, and married with three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store. Josephine has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns additional income from farming seaweeds.

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc. in her general store

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de algunas herramientas y equipo para hacer mejor los queques y panes, además de materia prima. Con estas compras espera obtener una mejor producción y en más cantidad para ofrecerle a los habitantes de las comunidad vecinas y un producto de mejor calidad y obtener poco más de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de repostería  y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Karina is 30 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings, who are her highest priority.  

With her loan, she would like to purchase some tools and equipment to make cakes and breads better, as well as raw ingredients.  With these purchases, she hopes to have a better production and greater quantity, in order to offer the members of the neighboring communities a better quality product.  She also hopes to earn a little more money and thus improve her family's living conditions, invest a little more in the area of pastries and also reach some goals.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has never had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with greater ease and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to produce pastries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase basins and wheelbarrows

loans.name: Ayikoè

texts.fr: Afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses clients, Ayikoè âgé de 42ans fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des boissons qu’il revend dans  une boutique. Il est père d’01 enfant de 09ans scolarisé et a pour conjointe une coiffeuse. Les profits tirés de la vente lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de la famille et de rendre son activité pérenne.
texts.en: To meet the needs of his customers, Ayikoè, aged 42, it applying for his first WAGES loan to purchase some beverages, which he sells in a store. He is the father of a 9-year-old child, who is in school. His wife is a hairdresser. The profits derived from the sales will enable him to support his family and make his business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase beverages

loans.name: Nabonswende Group

texts.fr:
Mme KADIDIA représente le groupe NABONSWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 02ans et le moins âgé a 07mois. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 07ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 et au grand marché. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 20complets pagnes  simple et 10complets de pagnes  bazin.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne étendre la limite de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. KADIDIA, the representative of the group NABONSWENDE, is married and the mother of two children. The oldest is 2 years old, and the youngest is 7 months old. None go to school, and she has three persons to support. 

Ms. KADIDIA has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) for seven years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market and at the big market. Her customers are both women and men. She wants to purchase 20 plain outfits of 'pagne' cloth and 10 damask outfits of 'pagne' cloth. 

She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase plain and damask outfits made of 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Zenen

texts.en:
Zenen is from Ubay, Bohol where she has been raising rice, her sole source of income, for 13 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to expedite the growth of her rice and protect it from sickness.

In the future, Zenen hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Josué

texts.es: Josué, tiene la edad  de 19 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así poder seguir estudiando y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Josué is 19 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his highest priority.

With his loan, he would like to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and pay for labor for tending the coffee crop.  He would also like to buy some copperwood plants to replant at the beginning of the rainy season.  This is to increase the density of plants, in addition to taking advantage of the good soil fertility and climatic and other conditions that favor the coffee crop.

With these improvements to the crop, he hopes to earn a little more money and thus be able to continue studying and improving his family's living conditions.  He would also like to invest a little more in the crop and also achieve some goals.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to tend to the coffee crop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 57 years old and is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lilia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Lilia has been in this business for thirty-five years. In the future, Lilia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen is 29 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. Her husband is a constructional worker and earns about 5,000,000 VND a month. Yen is also a constructional worker. She pours concrete in constructions, which she has been doing for three years. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND a month. 
 
Yen is requesting her second loan from SEDA for 9,632,000 VND, which she will use to buy constructional protection tools and tools to pour concrete productively. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009.  In the future, she wants to buy a concrete pouring machine.

loans.use: to purchase constructional protection tools and tools to pour concrete productively.

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
From buying vegetables and root crops in the market and selling them in different villages, Ma. Teresa now has a stall in the market selling a variety of vegetables. She shares that what she has now is just the fruit of her struggle in running the business. Ma. Teresa is a widowed mother of five children who are attending school.

After 12 years of running the business, Ma. Teresa is able to provide her children basic necessities and allowances in school. She wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy beans, carrots and cabbage to sell. She hopes to increase her income to further take care of her children's needs in school.

loans.use: to buy beans, carrots and cabbage to sell.

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Luis sigue con la misma actividad de la fabricación de Guinches y mescladoras, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un motor y materiales para su trabajo, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de herramienta y materiales para la fabricación de sus productos ya que tiene pedidos en esta época ya que tiene mucha demanda de este productos.
texts.en:
Luis continues with his business manufacturing winches and cement mixers.  

He says that the previous loan went well for him, since he used it to buy a motor and materials for his work.  

This time, he is applying for a loan to purchase tools and materials for the manufacture of his products, since he already has orders for the season and a lot of demand for these products.

loans.use: to purchase tools and materials.

loans.name: Abavumvu Gahinga Group

texts.fr:
Félicien est membre du groupe  ABAVUMVU GAHINGA , Il est marie  et est agé de 65 ans avec 4 enfants dont le plus grand a 40 ans et le plus petit a 15 ans. il a étudie les étude primaires .

Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter les ruches modernes car il fait l`élevage des abailles pour vendre le miel.

Il n`attend aucune difficultes pour le remboursement. ses strategies pour la croissance de son activité est de demander d`autres crédit pour financer son business.

ses ambitions est d`être l`apiculteur proffessionnel et pour sa famille c`est éduquer ses enfants
texts.en:
Félicien is a member of the group ABAVUMVU GAHINGA. He is married and is 65 years old with 4 children of whom the oldest is 40 years old and the youngest is 15 years old. He studied primary school.

He is requesting this loan to buy modern hives since he breeds bees to sell honey.

He doesn't expect any difficulties in repayment. His strategies for the growth of his business are to ask for other loans to finance his business.

His ambitions are to be a professional beekeeper and for his family to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy modern hives.

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a piggery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Menerva has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Menerva has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Constancia

texts.es: La Sra. Constancia sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo para el anticrético de una tienda  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería ropa por mayor ya  que incremento sus ventas y es necesario para incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Constancia continues to work buying and selling used clothing. She says that her previous loan was a a success, which she used for an antichresis rental arrangement for a store. This time, she is requesting a loan to buy clothing in bulk, because her sales have increased and she needs more clothing to boost her profits. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given to grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor tiene 26 años y es casado con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 2 años, el Sr. Víctor se dedica a la confección de trajes (especialidad sacos) en su sastrería que se encuentra que se en la zona Canadá,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Víctor va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital  de trabajo, el Sr. Víctor enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el de no contar con la maquinaria necesaria para la confección de sus prendas de vestir y con las ganancias seguirá comprando materiales y maquinaria para mejorar su taller de confección, el Sr. Víctor es una persona joven Emprendedora con gamas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is 26 years old, married and with one child, who is 2 years old.  Victor makes his living sewing suits (with a specialty in jackets) in his tailoring shop, which is located in the Canadá area.

This loan is his first with the institution.  Victor is going to use this loan to buy bolts of cloth to make his garments.  His reason for applying for this loan is to increase his working capital.  Victor faces challenges in his business, which are not having the necessary machinery for making his garments.  With his earnings, he will continue buying materials and machinery to improve his tailoring workshop.

Victor is a young, enterprising person with a desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for making suit pants, jackets and vests.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children who are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising livestock. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional livestock for her business. Marites has been raising livestock for four years now and has borrowed four loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines, and additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia, 54, is requesting a loan in order to expand her piggery business. An amount of PHP 12,000 will purchase three piglets to fatten up, and feed and vitamins for their good health. This will help her to be more profitable and successful. She believes that with hard work, she will be able to improve her family's financial status as well as save for use in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets to fatten up, and feed and vitamins

loans.name: Mariyan

texts.en:
Mariyan is a recurrent client of Yehu Microfinance Trust. She’s married and her husband is a driver. He works as a driver for a transportation firm and they live in Kisauni. 

Mariyan has had a grocery store since 1998. She’s repaid several loans to date and is asking for this one to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, tea, etc. to offer a wider variety of goods to her customers. With a great variety of products to offer her customers, she will earn a larger profit margin, which will help her improve her entire family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy beverages, baked goods, sugar, tea, etc. for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a very hard-working person. She explains that she has been able to get ahead thanks to her effort. The previous Kiva loan has been a big help to her and she is very grateful for it. 

Today, she comes again, to be able to supply her general store with basic staples such as beverages and soft drinks. These drinks will enable her to continue offering a good variety and good prices to her clients. She is again grateful for the opportunity she is receiving because it will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy beverages and soft drinks

loans.name: Club De La Amistad Group

texts.es: El grupo “CLUB DE LA AMISTAD” es uno de nuestros grupos recurrentes ellos se encuentran pasando el ciclo 24 son puntuales en sus cuotas grupales cada uno de sus integrantes están dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio. Margarita tiene 49 años es casada con 3 hijos. Trabaja en su bodega que puso en su casa haces 2 años. El préstamo que se le dio lo utilizara para comprar más productos para su bodega así como arroz, azúcar, bebidas, dulces. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Margarita es la segunda del lado derecho viste blusa  beige.
texts.en: The “CLUB DE LA AMISTAD” group is one of our recurrent groups. They are in their 24th cycle and are punctual with their group payments. Each member makes a living in different business activities. Margarita is 49 years old, and is married with three children. She works in her store which she opened in her home two years ago. She will use the loan to buy more products for her store such as rice, sugar, beverages and sweets. The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan. Margarita is the second from the right wearing a beige blouse.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and beverages.

loans.name: Marcia Hellen

texts.es:
Marcia,  45 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, madre de cuatro hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa. Es un cliente Kiva,  está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado porque poco a poco gracias al financiamiento obtenido ha ido creciendo como comerciante, apoyada por sus hijos quien la impulsa a salir   adelante.
Está requiriendo de su segundo  financiamiento para comprar ropa como pantalones, camisas, cazado, cosméticos, maniquines, Uno de sus propósitos  a realizar es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su negocio para ampliarlo mas hasta convertirlo en una tienda solo de ropa, para incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marcia is 45 years old, lives in the city of León, and is mother to four children. She is a trader, who works selling clothing. She is a Kiva client, and is very grateful for the support provided because little by little, thanks to the financing she has received she has gradually grown as a trader, supported by her children who push her to succeed.

Marcia is requesting her second loan to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, shoes, cosmetics and mannequins. One of her goals is to improve the infrastructure of her business to expand it more until she can make it into a clothes store alone, to boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as pants, blouses, cosmetics and mannequins,

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 47 years old and is married. She has two children who attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luisa has an ambulant business selling spices and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for fourteen years. She has requested a PHP 24,500 loan through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell. 

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money so she that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 15,000. This loan will be used to buy more supplies in bulk, such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers. As a result, she will be able to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies in bulk, such as fabrics of different types and colors, thread, buttons, and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
